I decided to go inside myself, for i know that if wait for Meena then i might have to wait for hours. As enter through the door, i remember what sucks of entering a house that's for a 10,000 mile tall girl. Each fiber that makes up Meena's carpet is about a few miles tall, yet to Meena the fibers are barley a 1/10 of inch. I start my walk through the forest of fibers as keep my eyes open for Meena. Not even ten minutes of walking, I felt a planet shaking earthquake, Meena is walking around.

My view was quickly replace a massive wall of silver fur that went high into the sky almost crushes me. I look up and see that the wall is Meena's foot. As i look, i can see that Meena is wearing Ant-man t-shirt, we were watching that movie last week, and wearing and blue shorts. I even see her wearing the large glasses she always wear. I knew her for a long time and knows that she loves games and any other pop-culture , but she also very shy and nervous when it comes to everyone. As much as she doesn't like being so shy, I always think that's what makes her so cute and that she is beautiful the way she is right now. I realize I'm distracting myself and shouted to Meena to look down.

"A-Alan?" Meena looks down and see a tiny speck next to her foot. "H-hey, Meena." Every time I see Meena, I could not help but feel a little nervous, which is ironic since it's Meena of all people I'm nervous of. "Y-you know to knock first, I almost step on you." She knees down to pick me up. "Sorry, but I came to help you like I said I would."

"Oh, that's right. Sorry for making you wait." Meena scratches the back of her head in slight embarrassment when she realize she forgotten about Alan.

"So what is that you need help with." I adjust myself to the middle of Meena's palm.

"I, um..." She looks nervous like she thinks that I'm not going to like what she's about to ask. "...I...need you..."
14112.title: I'm impatient

"A-actually..." She tries to hide something behind her.

"A project?" I remember that Meena does goes to a university. To everyone, she can be a huge nerd when it comes to a lot of pop-culture, but to me, Meena is very intelligent compare to most people in the university she goes to.

"Yes, I'm doing a project for science and physics classes, and I need a little help from someone I know. Particularly help from a certain human i know." Meena twiddles her thumb as she obviously points out who she wants help from.

"Science and physics? Does it has to do something with today's theme shirt?" I said it jokingly for every time Meena has a project or assignment she has to do, I always see her doing a project involving one of the shirts she likes to where. "Wha?" Meena stammers taken aback by your comment. "No Alan." she replies with a rather meek headshake. "It has nothing to do with my shirt this time around."

Meena looks down at you and her look is an adorable combination of surprise and embarrassment. "I have the math worked out" she starts "I just need you to help test my invention, a fabric that can absorb enough energy to protect a human from any impact!"

You are stunned, scientists of both sizes have been trying to develop such a material for a long time. "Of course I'll help you test it!" You say excitedly.

Meena arrives at her work bench a few minutes later the invention was sitting out and it looked like...
14112211.title: Something Physics related

14112212.content:
Wet gurgle exits her stomach, Meena blushing from the embarrassment of it.
"That!"
"Excuse me?" You asked confused.
"I have a bio project and it's based on the digestive system," Meena said, almost to a whisper, her request finally clicking in.
"You want me to go inside of you?" You ask, in pure shock, Meena nodding her head sadly.
"You go in and film my insides. I even tested a suit out and it came out fine, but if you don't want to, it's okay," she said, trying to reassure you.
Meena was a nice girl, though very shy, but she wouldn't intentionally hurt anybody. Besides you, you kinda of have a bit of a crush on her and you believe it's vise versa for her. But, still, you were going to enter her stomach and it's a dangerous place. Meena was looking at you with a loving gaze, while you were thinking about it. She had a crush on you for a long time, ever since you were kids, and wanted to tell you, but she was too shy to do so.
"I made my decision," you loudly stated, snapping Meena out of her daze.
"Yes, what?" She asks, curiously.
14112212.title: Keep your friends close, your love inside of you

141122122.content:
Upon hearing Meena's request, a great deal of apprehension befell your mind. "Well-" you begin, uncertain how Meena would exactly take your refusal. "Look Meena, it does sound like an...interesting project." you admit, not wanting to sound like you were completely against her plan. "But...well, this isn't some kind of comic book." You add as your eyes momentarily glimpse towards the side, away from the massive batgirl.

"What do you mean?" Meena asks, uncertain about your response. "I...I made the suit myself and was testing it for months! it came out perfectly a-okay." she beams slightly, as if trying to assure you of the safety of her plan.

"But how can you be so sure i'll be safe inside you?" you retort as you gaze back at her. Meena's face slightly contorts with confusion by your assumption as you soon continue onwards. "I mean...the whole idea sounds like something straight outta some sci-fi movie Meena. And, well that's just it. Sci-fi!" you nearly shout with unease. "How many times in those movies did something end up going wrong? like some spacesuit's lifeline malfunctioning? or worse?" you ask with an incredulous face.

"But...this won't take place in space." Meena counter's as her voice begins to soften up a bit from your words.

"Oh you know what I mean." You scowl lightly as the giant batgirls once curious face starts to contort into an almost distressed expression. Your eyes widen by her expression as a good surge of guilt rushes down your spine. "M-Meena. I know you're a smart bat." you quickly call out, not wanting to insult her new idea. "But...Just how is this idea going to work in a real-life context?" you ask, still uncertain if her whole bio plan will come into fruition.

Two or three seconds of silence creep up as Meena raises a slightly balled hand up to her face while deep in a pondering state. "I..." she spoke, quickly breaking up the quiet tension. "I made sure to test the suit's protection, as well as it's effects on the environment." Her eyes soon befall you once more. "Things like extreme heat, let alone bodily fluids like acid did absolutely no harm to it whatsoever." She continues before soon giving a defeated sigh. "But...you're probably right." she admits with a weak nod before shaking her head. "What was I thinking?" she mutters despondently. "S-Sorry Alan, this was a stupid request."

Her words, let alone her expression, felt like a bunch of knives stabbing your heart as you couldn't help but view yourself as a villain at the moment. "Well..." You quickly reply after a second of hesitation. "Are...you really certain the suit held up?" you ask as Meena's eyes widen ever so lightly from the sudden question. "Like no holes, or anything like that?" you continue as your massive neighbor meekly nods.

"P-Positive." she stutters, easily taken aback by your question. "I...can show you the suit if you like." she adds.

With one last sigh, you gaze square up at Meena's eyes and-
141122122.title: A dangerous voyage?

choices: "I'm sorry, but it seems too risky."
1411221221.content:
As you gaze up at Meena's face, a small twinge ends up pulling your heart strings. Seeing her looks so distraught was enough to make even the coldest of villains look down in shame, well to your mind at least. Seeing as how it wouldn't hurt to check out the suit, you give a shaky sigh and nod. "Alright then. I guess it wouldn't hurt to check out the suit real quick."

Meena's eyes brighten ever so slightly by your words as she quickly shakes her head feverishly. "r-right." she replies as her huge palm soon descends right before you. "Climb on, i'll take you to my room." While the whole idea of entering a girl's room might seem awkward, let alone somewhat pervy in the eyes of others. You've known Meena for long enough that you visited her so called 'lab' for years now. Upon clambering onto the side of her finger and making your way to the middle of her palm, you motion a thumbs up towards her face. "All prepped." you call out, like an astronaut about to get blasted off to the stars. Stifling a small giggle, the giant bat girl slowly rises up as she begins to turn face back into her home.

After a few minutes of walking, Meena soon enters into her room as she places you ever so caringly upon her desktop. Like usual, the surrounding wooden top is covered in books and other sets of metallic devices that you could only guess were her other experiments at hand. "Looks like you've been pretty busy." You admit as you make your way towards on large book spine that seemed to read 'chemical mixing 101'.

"Well....I guess i'm just the type of anthro who loves research." Meena replies in a kind yet flustered tone as you see her rummaging about below in a wooden box. Curious, you make your way towards the edge of the table side to peek down at her. “Here it is!” she beams as her head rises up like lava erupting from a volcano, causing you to stumble back in shock. As you try and regain your footing from the sudden shock, your eyes ascend towards the upper half of her body, as her right index finger and thumb were pinching something in between. Noticing your curious expression, Meena lowers her hands before you as she gently pulls back her fingers to reveal her so called ‘Suit’.

“That’s…the suit?” you ask perplexed as Meena nods her head. “What do you think?” She returns as your eyes begin to draw upon the odd design of the protective attire. Strangely enough, it looked almost like a mix between an astronaut’s suit and a diving suit manufactured in the 20th century. In fact the helmet seemed to be nothing more than a metallic dome with a circular hole cut right in the middle. As you were busy her creation, Meena begins to catch on to your perplexed reaction.

“Is something wrong?” She asks as she tilts her bat head at her own question. “Well…It does look like something that can withstand some pressure.” You admit as you walk on up and gently give the odd helmet surface a knock. “Of course.” Meena nods. “I managed to fashion the suit using a highly tolerable plastic.” “Plastic?” you ask, questioning whether or not such material could withstand something like acid. “Yes, but not just normal Plastic.” Meena reiterates. “it contains a sturdiness and well defense that’s enough to withstand many harmful materials.” She states. “Including digestive juices.”

Surprised by her sudden explanation you can’t help but eye her and the odd suit multiple times. “Well…say I do go inside your body.” You begin. “How can I communicate with you? Let alone breath in you?” Meena’s face brightens up even more by your questions, as if she’s slowly raising her hopes on you considering the task. “Well, I managed to install a small radio device in the suit.” She begins with the first response. “With that, you should be able to talk to me with ease. And as for air, well I was thinking maybe giving you some oxygen through a pump outside.”

“Wait…you’re planning on just keeping a pump stuck to the suit the whole time?” you asked completely confused. “Well…it would not only give you oxygen, but it would also help me pull you out in case there was any accidents.” The sudden mention of accidents brings a small shiver coursing down your body as Meena continued to stare down at you. With all this work she did, it definitely would seem like a jerk move to turn her down now. However, the unpredictability of the whole event could lead to serious trouble. After seconds of inner arguing, you give a long exhale before gazing back up to her eyes. “Meena-“

To you, Meena is one of those people that you want to help no matter what because of the kindness she given to you since you known each other. You always helped Meena with her projects because you are close friends with her and you always like to her smile, so doing this project won't be any different.

"So should we do this project now, Meena?" Meena places both you and the gun on the table before she talks.

"Actually, let me get my camera so I can record the testing. I'll be right back." Meena goes to her room to fetch her camera. As she was gone, you had time to look at the gun before...

141122221.title: Ant Size To Meena

141122222.content:
Living with Anthros has always been an adjustment for humanity. A difficult one, considering the scale difference. But thanks to a combination of human and anthro technologies and science, there isn't an Anthro alive who's eyesight isn't keen enough to see a human, even with their 10,000 mile height difference. Unfortunately as good as Anthros are at spotting humans, it should go without saying that humans tend to go unnoticed, as anyone might expect. If an Anthro isn't close to you and you're not in a crowd, you might as well not exist.

Which is why it's pretty unfortunate you that you're now so terribly, terribly small in comparison to the rest of the world.

"Oh my god." is all you can say, gazing out across the tabletop towards the massive ray gun that did this to you. Remember the apple? It shrank from the size of atleast a hundred miles tall down to what you would consider to be a regular apple. And that size ratio was never reset, so now you're... well, it's difficult to tell how small exactly. But you're pretty sure you're somewhere underneath an inch tall. A regular human would look gigantic to you, and the rest of her home was unfathomably huge now.

Thank goodness." You let out a sigh. "Violet, don't you remember. You took your glasses to be repaired?" The panda giantess blushes slightly. "Sorry Alan. But it's just you and me in the book store and I tend to get carried away."

As you got into your car and onto the road, you truly were in awe of the complicated system society had worked out with the coexistence of humans and anthros. Roads for humans were carefully built so that they never came in contact with any frequented Furry's travels, and vice versa. Humans were protected, and anthros were left out of the guilt of crushing innocents beneath them. Once you drove into town, the usual sights greeted you. Varying levels of buildings, from human, to towering complexes that could only house the gargantuan beings. You parked your car, stepped outside, and looked up at one of the massive buildings that could easily cover the country, but do to the anthro's technology, it didn't. And boy, was it an eyesore. Dolly's Spa & Salon was where you worked. Not your favorite place in Coalton Shores, but it did pay the bills.

"Alan!"Dolly's shrill, superfluous voice was the first thing you heard the moment you stepped into the Salon. Once inside, a menagerie blast of perfume, soaps, and other fragrances hit your senses, temporarily stunning you with their strength. Sometimes, anthros forget that everything they do is magnified to the tiny humans below, and even a dash of a few air fresheners that Dolly leaves out is like dropping a bomb of oversensory smells upon a city. You shook your head to clear it and looked around, the lobby as big and pink as it usually was, Dolly's annoyed glance catching your eye from behind the counter. In a few, booming steps, her massive paws that dwarfed mountains landed in front of you, her towering form looking down at you spitefully."Alan, you're late."

You looked up, but not too much, Dolly sometimes liked to wear skirts to work."There was traffic on the way here."You lied. There was never any traffic in Coalton Shores.

She squinted her eyes angrily."Just make sure it doesn't happen again. Your job is on the line, little man."

You sighed."Just give me my to-do list for today. What is it? Refill the shampoo bottles?"You groaned inwardly at the thought of this task. Dolly only had you do it twice before, and each time, you had ended up trapped inside the bottle you were refilling with a dump truck full of body wash.

"Not this time."The Poodle anthro replied, almost chuckling a little after."You get to work in the pedicure section today!"

You gave another short sigh."C'mon Dolly, you know that's dangerous for me! I could get crushed..."

"I won't hear a word of it! That's your job, and it's final!"She gave another laugh, this time wiggling her own titanic toes, creating cataclysmic quakes that knocked you flat on your bum."I'd have you do my own, but you know the whole boss-employee thing. All you have to do is simple: Walk up to any lady in there and ask her if you could either clean her toes, give a little paw rub, or even do her nails. Simple."

"...Fine."

You went off towards a passageway specially designed for humans to navigate the giant building, using the space-bending technology that made travel so much easier. You crossed entire miles in just a few steps through a doorframe, and you were in the pedicure/nails section of the spa. You decide to walk up to the first chair closest to you.

You forgot that while all anthros had five fingers on each hand like humans do, most of them who had toes had only four toes. This depended on species though, because they had the same number of toes as real animals do on their back legs.

143.title: A Walk Around 10,000 Mile Beings

1431.content:
"Eh, might as well head around town."You mumble to yourself as you step outside. It beat being cooped up inside all day in your musty-smelling place anyway. You got in your car, drove off, and in about thirty minutes time, you were in the localized central of the small town of Coalton Shores. You parked on the side of the road, filled the meter with an hour's amount of change, and just began roaming. You passed by many familiar faces, some human, others of varying species, but you waved anyway and greeted with a hello. At least that was an upside to living in a small community, you knew everybody.

Your thoughts were interrupted as you slammed into a massive black wall, nearly breaking your nose when your face met it. You backed away and looked up, the giant wall extending beyond the clouds. If you craned your neck back hard enough and squinted, you could make out that this massive wall was simply a trudge to to black leather boots. Extending higher and higher, a massive cat girl, black furred and clad in an equally black hoodie and shorts, looked down at you quizzically with her wide, bright green eyes.

Scratch your previous statement. You almost knew everybody. This gargantuan anthro before you was Lily, and you had never spoken to her before. To be honest, you thought nobody had ever talked to her before. She was always quiet, reserved, and in the corner. She wandered around town aimlessly everyday, and you had no idea if she even lived here.

"Um...hey...Lily."You called up to her. Surprisingly, she opened her mouth to speak.

14313.content: "Ew!" yells Lily. "Ugh! A human!" Lily then pushes you aside with her foot as you let out a grunt. As you look up, you see Lily running off to get away from you. Well, at least you now know how she feels about humans. The way she acted was like a normal human's reaction to a cockroach. But you noticed something about her just before she kicked you. She had a look on her face, as if it was fear. It was one thing for humans to be afraid of anthros, but for an anthro to be afraid of humans? That's bizarre. Of course you didn't know Lily that well. This was strange.

You decide to get to the bottom of this. "Lily can't possibly be afraid of humans could she? She's 10,000 miles tall, why would she be afraid of humans? Of course it would explain why she never talks to anyone." At this moment, Lily had stopped running and she's walking normal. You decide to follow close by. As Lily was walking away, she was looking around and then let out a sigh. She seemed to be in a hurry to get home and even put her hood on over her head, but you keep following her and she doesn't even see you.

Lily takes her time getting home. She must live on a far part of town. Along the way, you see her acting strange a few times. She ran right past a woman with a baby carriage and looked the other way when a pair of humans were carrying a mirror right past her. If another anthro like Betty or Lalonde came in, they would've helped without being asked but the way Lily was acting, it was like she wanted to be ignored. Maybe anthros with human phobia really did exist.

As you keep tailing Lily, you see her walk into the video store and grab the heel of one of her boots to get a closer look. Then you remember why you didn't like going to the video store. One of the clerks, Ryan, a giant husky anthro had a grudge against you for always having the videos in late. He was such a Nazi when it came to that and you remember the last time he warned you that one more late video and he'd revoke your membership. That guy has serious OCD.

As you continue to watch Lily, she has picked up a few movies she wanted to rent and walks up to Ryan. "Hi Lily," says Ryan in a surprisingly friendly tone. You'd think that Ryan wouldn't get along with Lily since he was a dog and she was a cat. "Haven't seen you in the store for a while. Lily didn't answer and instead handed Ryan the movies she planned to buy. "Night of the Killer Canary, The Venomous Duck, The Mouse Returns. Yep sounds like Lily's normal horror movie night. I'll bet nothing scares you except for...." Suddenly Ryan stops and sniffs the air. "That's odd," he says as he turns his head. "I just picked up a familiar scent, the type I don't like." Ryan grits his teeth and begins to growl as Lily looks in confusion. Uh-oh, has that husky noticed you yet?

"Alan!" yells Ryan. "When are you going to return Road Rovers video from three weeks ago?" "Come on Ryan, cut me some slack. It didn't last as long as it should've." Lily just hisses again and even sticks her tail in the air. "Get him away from me Ryan! Get that human away from me!" Ryan lets out a growl and walks from behind the counter to walk up to you. But that didn't make sense seeing as she was 10,000 miles high.

"Wait, what, why? Ah!" Before you can say anything, Ryan picks you up, walks out of the store and tosses you into an anthro sized trash can before walking back into the store. You let out a grunt as you climb out of the trash and back down to the ground, shaking bubble gum off of yourself. "Geez, what a jerk. Huh?" You turn your head to see Lily running out of the door with her movies. Now you know why she never speaks to anyone. But why would a giant anthro be afraid of humans? If it was the other way around, it would make a lot more sense.

What do you do now?

1432.content:
You decided to head to town and visit the local supermarket, Jiffy Mart. You pulled your wallet out of your back pocket and thumbed through it, making sure you had at least enough cash to buy some groceries. Eh, a hundred bucks after paying down the rent to your small home, and you had to keep it all together until next payday, so you decided to keep splurging to a minimum. You got in your little beat-up car, revved the engine, and you were out of the driveway, waving up at your titanic neighbors as you drove down the street.

"Hey there Al!"You heard Reggie's thunderous, upbeat voice call down to you with your least favorite shortening of your name. You looked up, and couldn't even see past her ankles today. There were too many clouds in the sky today."Uhh...hey Reg!"You shouted up in reply. She followed back with her signature howling laughter. You took it that she was in at least a good mood today, but you didn't know, she was always laughing, a hyena thing. You drove by Lalonde's home next, but it appeared she wasn't anywhere in sight. You wondered where she could be? The sheep girl was such a socialite, she was always out around the neighborhood, chatting it up to whomever would stand her bleating.

As you left the neighborhood behind, you simply went into a casual driving stance, one had on the wheel, the hanging out the window. You began to survey the area around you. For the most part, it was empty flatlands. When the anthros arrived years ago, a good majority of the planet had been terraformed to massive fields of grass to keep the godlike creatures from crushing anything underneath. It was for the better, a single anthro alone could level entire mountain ranges with their toes alone. With their highly advanced technology, though a culture quite similar to humankind, each race quickly adapted to one another. Space-defying buildings were set up that were bigger on the inside than the outside, or vice versa. Roadways for humans were made, and walking paths for furries were set up as well. Overall, it was quite peaceful. Though, there were troublemakers on both sides. On the humans, you had the anti-anthros running about, claiming that they were just monsters that were waiting for the perfect time to kill and enslave us all. On the anthro side, you had the terrorists who believed humans were nothing but vermin to be crushed and or enslaved. You shuddered a bit as you drove, remembering a news story about one particular anthro terrorist that demanded ransom for some captured humans, was denied it, and she decided squish all of New York City under her foot. That was in the earlier years, back when relations were rough. The criminal had been caught, the city already rebuilt bigger and better, but the shock of all those lives just simply vanishing never went away.

You shook your head from memories and returned to your driving, the small town of Coalton Shores just up ahead. It was always boring, even with the giant animal beings around. There was nothing to do but either work in the coal mines, move away, or stay and stagnate your life. You've been hoping to move away, but you've never had the chance to stash enough money. Something always came up, and you've been stuck in your little run-down home. At least your neighbors were interesting enough.

You pulled up your car into the parking lot, choosing a nice spot right at the front beside an anthro's titanic jeep, their tire tread large enough to move landmasses if it wanted to. You got out, clicked to lock the car, and started walking. There was a nice little door there for you, and you entered the Jiffy Mart. Humans and anthros alike browsed the aisles, the humans up in the racks of products to keep from getting stepped on, and the furries around shelves holding their own equally large produce. A small turtle anthro child, barely a thousand miles tall, pointed at you just as you grabbed some chips.

"Look mommy, another one of those little toys! I want one!"

"Now son, those aren't toys. They're living beings."The gargantuan mother replied to her shelled son. He simply pouted as he walked away, eying you a little. You shrugged. He was just a kid who didn't know any better.

Once you had gathered a handful of meager groceries, you went up to the checkout counter to see a familiar face.

"Hello-o-o Betty!"You called up.

A massive wall of furred black and white turned around to greet you."Alan! It's been a while!"A southern female voice replied, though much more deeper and thunderous."Ah thought you had gone up and went to that fancier supermarket on the other side of town!"Betty brought her face down to look at you, very female in appearance, yet retaining features of a human and that of a cow. She was a bit chubby, but it added to her cute factor. She even had a nose ring like a bull's going through both nostrils.

"Nah, that place is way overpriced."You replied."Plus, my favorite cow always gives me a discount, right?"You flashed her a big grin, to which she only rolled her eyes and slightly smiled back.

Betty reared up to her full height as she took your groceries and prepared to check them, giving you a nice view of her massive breasts, or for the correct term, udders. They were snugly clad in a red plaid shirt sporting a nice bit of cleavage for her.

"Alright, there ya go, Al."She handed you your bags with amazing dexterity of her fingers, taking your money just as easily.

"No prob."You wave up at her as you leave, but suddenly...

"Hey, wait!"Betty's thundering voice boomed right as you were about to leave through the human-sized down near the check-out counter. A massive wall of splotched black and white slammed down in front of you to keep you from walking any further, Betty's pinky finger. You turned around to look at her, and she nervously drew her finger back, a grin of uncertainty and forced nonchalant on her face."What's up, Betty?"You ask her.

"Ah was uh..wonderin' if'n ya'll had any plans tonight."

You shrugged."Not really. I was gonna head home and maybe watch some tv, eat some snacks I just bought."

"If um...after my shift, maybe we could...spend some time together?"

Did Betty just ask you out on a date? You had known her for a good while, and mostly considered her a friend. She was roughly around your age, or at least, you think she was. Anthros lived so much longer than humans. You had considered her nice and cute, but had never had 'datable' come across your mind. A human-anthro relationship wasn't uncommon,and it certainly wasn't looked down upon, but the odd thought never came to you until now.

"Well, uh..."You open your mouth to speak, Betty's eyes pleadingly looking down at you. You wondered what she saw? Obviously, it wasn't in the looks department, seeing as you were too small for her to properly make out, a mere mite of dust that could be swept away with the slightest of movements from her. But maybe it was the friendship with her that started it, our your words? You had no idea.

That sounds great then, Alan! We have a date!"She giggled slightly, something you don't hear often from the southernly inclined, hard-working cow anthro. You shrugged and gave her a wave before heading out the human exit."I'll see you after your shift!"You called over your shoulder to her, to which was replied another thunderstorm of rapid giggles. You allowed a small smile to play across your face. Who knew? Betty might just be the gal for you.

Several Hours Later

You leaned against your car at around 7:00pm, the night sky showing bright speckles of starlight scattered across the inkiness, outlined by the silvery moon. Most of the parking lot was empty, save for a few stragglers getting their last-minute groceries, both human and anthro alike. You were alerted by seismic stomps that nearly rocked you off your feet as two massive hooves landed right in front of you with a heavy thud, each one an insurmountable wall. "Alan!"She boomed happily from above in her cute accent."Glad ta see you! So, watcha wanna do tonight?"She asked as she knelt down slowly, bringing her finger down next to you, motioning you to climb on. You scrambled up until you were on her massive nail that entire neighborhoods could rest on.

She pointed up with her free hand, outlining a small star that shone a bit brighter than the rest."That one there's Zoonova."

"The anthro home planet?"You ask, wondering how she knew which one was her home out of the millions of other lights in the sky.

You look around awkwardly, waiting for Betty to return. The silence is killing you so you decide to try and start a conversation. Turning to face Ana you are greeted with her gigantic face hovering at point blank range in front of you. With a yelp you fall back onto your butt, causing the great cow woman to chuckle. "You really are a cutie." she says, picking you up and setting you back on your feet. "Thanks..." you manage to say. Spending time with anthros has made you less nervous around them, but having Ana so close, studying you in detail is a bit unnerving. "You seem like such a nice boy, I'm glad Betty managed to wrangle a guy like you." she says. Unlike Betty's southern accent, which is very cute, Ana's thicker accent somehow makes her seem sexier. You blush at her compliment and she rubs your little head. Her building sized finger feels so gentle, just like her daughter's. You would try and talk some more but for some reason you're mesmerized by the petting and her giant face. She just sits there and enjoys your company until Betty returns.

When you hear the rumbling that signals Betty's return you look toward the door. She enters the room with a bottle of wine and a couple of glasses. "Did you two have a nice chat?" she asks as she sets the glasses down. Each one towers over you, many times taller than anything humans could build. "Sort of. We just kind of enjoyed each other's company." Ana said, giving you an additional stroke on the back. You gaze up as Betty pours some wine into each glass. Its like a waterfall rushing into an enormous bowl. The glasses are then suddenly lifted away as the cows take their first sips. "Oh, come on Alan!" Betty says and lifts you up. The table gets farther and farther away as she lifts you up to her glass. When the ride stops you're being held above her wine. "Come on, have some!" she insists. You try to take a sip but end up up taking a big gulp instead. Betty places you on her shoulder when she sees you've had some and begins chatting with her mother. "So how far have you two gone?" Ana asks. "Mom!" Betty says with a roll of her eyes. "I'm just curious! Has he had your milk?" the older woman presses further. You don't answer but the blush on both of your faces tells her everything. With a smirk Ana takes another drink of wine.

A little later the bottle of wine is almost gone. These girls really like their alcohol. You stare up at the giant bottle and Ana's face suddenly appears next to you. "Betty can sure drink huh?" she asks, the wine on her breath smothering you. "Although wine is more my thing. She prefers stuff like beer and whiskey." You back up from the tipsy cow only to back into a second massive face. Betty, who is now also up close, glares at her mom. "Whats that supposed to mean? You make it seem like I'm some drunk!" she says. The two of them are feeling pretty loose right now, and their accents have turned into a strong southern drawl. Suddenly Betty pushes you onto the table with her lips, giving you a sloppy kiss. "Aaww!" Ana says before taking another drink from the bottle. Betty snatches it from her and takes her own swig. You just stare up while laying on your back, their huge bosoms taking up your view. A drop of wine splashes into your face, giving you another big gulp. Although you haven't had nearly as much as them, you've had quite a bit. It doesn't take too much longer for you to black out.

When you wake up you find yourself on some very soft ground. When you roll over you see a huge nipple towering over you and deduce that you've been sleeping on Betty's breast. The rumbling snores tell you that she's asleep right now. Feeling hungover you crawl to the nipple and through sheer willpower climb to the top. You're very thirsty and remember how great Betty's milk was. With all the focus you can muster you try and stimulate her nipple until just as planned a drop of milk comes out. You plunge your face into it and drink up, relishing the taste. Its then that the woman you're on wakes up, and you realize its...
143211221211.title: Tipsy Cows

You give her a smile before heading out of the human-sized exit towards your car, tossing in your groceries and revving up the engine, only to drive away as quick as you could. Man, that was awkward. You didn't want to break the cowgirl's heart, but you really weren't interested in dating her.

You shrugged as you continued driving.
143212.title: You lie and say you have somewhere else to be

Betty gets interrupted by another anthro
1432122.content:
It was minor at first, just a little quake. They happened all the time seeing as there were anthros all over the planet now. Small earthquakes were a mundane thing now, and you barely noticed it. But slowly, the rhythmic quake of a giant anthro's footsteps grew closer and closer. Curiously, you looked in your rearview mirror, and what you saw nearly gave you a heart attack. Betty's colossal, curvaceous form was stomping towards you with great, mighty strides. The very worst part though, she had an expression of pure rage on her face.

"Alan! Ah know ya lied ta me!" She thundered, giving you all the incentive you needed to step on the gas and go as fast as your little car could take you. Unfortunately, it was pretty much pointless. Trying to outrun a ten-thousand mile tall anthro was absolutely impossible, as with every thundering hoofstep, she crossed many, many times, it only taking her about two and a half steps to stomp her hoof right in front of you, causing you to slam on breaks.

You stopped the car and gazed upwards, the titanic wall of her black hoof stretching to the sky to make way for her towering body overhead. You gulped, rolled up the windows, locked the doors, and prepared for what may come.
1432122.title: Betty knows you lied, and she is MAD

As you crouch back in your car seat, You see Betty's massive angry eye in front of you and then you hear her give an angry snort. "Come on Betty," you say. "Aren't you overreacting. Ah!" Betty tosses your car into the air and then catches again as she rocks it. "Overreacting nuthin' sug," says that titanic cow woman. "You dun't seem t'have anything better to do and I asked real nice. But y'all had to go and blow it! You mess with Betty and you get the horns!" You let out a gulp. Even the nice anthros can be very dangerous to humans if angered enough and Betty was so big you were less than an ant to her. She could crush you if she wanted to.

But Betty just let out a snort and then opened up her cleavage to drop your car in where you land with a crash and your groceries spill all over you. "Y'all just lucky I got work t'do. But as soon as I punch out, hell shall hath no fury hon!" This was bad. Human sized women scorned were hard enough to deal with. But this was Betty you were talking about. She wasn't a vicious anthro. She wouldn't torture you, you hope.

All you could see were black and white hairs the size of trees as Betty walked back into the store. After several hours, Betty finally closes the market and walks away with you in her cleavage. From the stomping noises, she was still mad. But you're in big trouble now. You lied to her, right to her face and now she was going to punish you severely. You should've agreed to the date.

Where is she taking you?

Before you could even get up, Betty slams down a jar on top of you.

One of the nice anthros was going to pulverize you in the worst way. But she said that she had to change first. You watch as she's taking off her shirt. Your jaw drops as Betty comes in all dressed up in a red spandex outfit that accentuates her large breasts and shows off her titanic udder. She was also wearing a pair of fishnet stockings and holding up a whip. "B-B-Betty?" you ask. Betty snorts and swings her whip to knock away the jar covering you. "That's Mistress Betty to you hon. I tried to be nice and if y'all were really busy, I would've let it slide. You could've just said ya weren't interested in me, but ya blew it big time when you lied to me!"

Betty swings her whip into the air and then you step back. "Calm down Betty. Don't do anything.... Ah!" Betty swings her whip and misses you, making you scream. "Dance cowboy," says Betty. "Dance!" Betty swings her whip all around and you have to jump from back and forth and even slide on the ground. A whip that size would hurt like the dickens and you scream loudly as the whip hits you in the shoulder. You feel like your shoulder has been dislocated, but there's no time to hold on because Betty comes closer to the table and swings her whip more fiercely and you can barely dodge. The whip even hits you in the knee and you are forced to slide back and forth on the table as she keeps whipping at you.

All you can see as you look up is a pair of titanic bovine breasts big enough to crush mountainsides. You hated to admit it, but that red dominatrix outfit made Betty look even hotter than normal. You're starting to think that you really should've agreed to the date. But now you have a date with a whip.

Scream until you like it!" Betty then whips you in the crotch and you scream louder than ever before. Beware the nice ones indeed. This woman was more merciless than you give her credit for.

It goes on again for an hour and by the time it's over, your body is covered in red whip wounds and Betty is laughing wickedly. "Gosh shucks," she says. "I haven't had this much fun in years." You gulp. Betty is implying she's done this before. Who knew she could be so psychotic." As you stagger to get up, Betty whips you one last time and you groan.

The cow giantess laughs wickedly as all 10,000 miles of her looms over you. "Well hon," she says. "You feeling so cocky now? Now, I've got one last punishment I'm going to give you, but I'm gonna be a little old sport and let you decide." Betty laughs and shakes her hips as you're horrified.

"Okay, for your last punishment, you can either polish my hooves, or I can mail you to a pen pal of mine. There's an anthro out there even bigger than me and she really knows how to punish pretty little liars like you. Well Alan, what's it gonna be?" You gulp because you know either way, you're screwed.

What do you decide for your punishment?
14321221111.title: Whip it Good

14321221112.content:
The whipping goes on for fifteen more minutes and in that time, you're tired and bruised from Betty's whip action. Then Betty picks you up and you let out a groan. Betty just snorts in your face. "And I thought bulls were the ones with the temper." You mumble under your breath. "I done heard that Alan!" yells Betty. "And don't think I'm goin' soft on ya at any rate. I just have something else in mind and it ain't pretty." Betty tosses you into the air and you scream before she whips you right into her couch. Its softness being the only reason you're still alive.

You cough and hold your head and then you see Betty stomping forward. "Come on Betty. Aren't you overreacting a little bit? I do think you're beautiful." "I'm sure," the giantess bovine says. "You say you want my bod, I'll give it to ya sweetie. I'll give ya more of me than you 'kin take! Much more." Betty turns around and you see something that fills you with both awe and fear at the same time. Like an asteroid, Betty's moon sized, red spandex covered rear comes down on you hard and pushes you into the couch. You grunt as you're buried underneath Betty's massive cheek. The full weight was crushing you, it was Betty's soft cough cushions that prevented you from being squashed into a red spot on the cow's rear.

Even for a 10,000 mile tall anthro, Betty was quite heavy, she was on the pudgy side and she was a cow, an animal heavy enough at normal size. You try to move, but Betty has you pinned down and then flips on the TV. "It's yer own fault hun," she says. "I think three hours under my tomatoes will teach you not to lie to a giant heifer." Betty even wiggles her behind and grinds on you. You cough a few times before Betty bounces up and down on you. You can't hear anything besides your captor's voice and to make matters worse, Betty was sweating and you swallowed some cow sweat and cough. The scary part is that Betty is one of the nice anthros. But even a nice anthro, especially a giantess woman, can fly off the handle. For three hours Betty wiggles her rear with you underneath and then she gets up and gives a smirk as she looks back to see you stuck to her behind like a tattoo. "You like?" she asks. You're too weak to even give a response. You really wish you agreed to that date right now.
14321221112.title: Steer Bum

143212211122.content:
Betty looks back at your battered, flattened form plastered onto her rump for a bit longer, then looks forward again as she walks away from the couch. "Well Alan, as much as I'd like to keep this up all evening, I'm a workin' girl, and workin' girls need their rest. So I'll be turning it for the night." She says it casually, like she didn't just spend three hours torturing you. The motion of her walking actually loosens you from her rear, but at this height falling off would be a death sentence.
Thus, you have no choice but to actually grab onto her spandex-clad rear and hold on tight to keep from slipping off.

         You hear Betty chuckle. "Oh? You like it back there, Alan? Well don't worry, you'll be there all night!"
Before you can ask what she means by that, you suddenly feel Betty's rear descending once again--this time onto a mattress. Given how soft the bed was it wasn't as agonizing as Betty sitting on you at the couch, and since she was soon lying down--on her back, of course, to keep you pinned--you didn't have all of her considerable weight pressing down on you.
Not that made it any less horrible.

         You wriggle around under Betty's rump, trying to get free, but all you manage to do is make the titanic cow-woman giggle in her sleep. It keeps up for hours, but the best you manage is to get your upper body out from under the red meteor of pain; your waist and legs still pinned. With the pressure (mostly) lifted, you flop down onto the soft sheets, panting in the cool air in Betty's bedroom as your eyes adjust to the dark. The fresh air was a godsend; for the past three hours you had had to take short, desperate gasps when ever Betty had bounced off of you.

         You'd probably have lain there all night moping if something hadn't occurred to you: it was nighttime now, at least ten o'clock. Betty had snatched your car out of the road and stomped off to her house to torture you, literally in broad daylight! For all intents and purposes, she had kidnapped you in a city full of witnesses!

         So where in the name all off hell were the cops all this time?!? The fact that Betty had put you through this hellish day, without interruption...it was mind-boggling. Did the cops have some sort of 'no-angry-women' policy when it came to anthros, or some nonsense? You made a mental note to really pay attention next time you voted for police commissioner.
Your mental rant was interrupted by the subtle, quiet sound of someone cutting through glass in the front room--a window, definitely a window. Shortly after that, scurrying footsteps--human ones--then a door opening, and the louder footsteps of an anthro of unidentified species. You raise yourself from the sheets as the intruders enter the bedroom, flashlights aglow...just as Betty stirs awake.
143212211122.title: Torment Interrupted

1432122111222.content:
To your horror, from the looks of it, it wasn't a cop coming to your rescue. As you look through the sheets, you can make out that the anthro was female, a giant green skinned velociraptor woman with a golden yellow underbelly and black stripes on her body with white hair that appeared to have rainbow highlights inside of it. She looked like she was just as chubby as Betty and it also looked like the giantess was dressed in black.

From the looks of it, this anthro was a burglar and also from the looks of it, she had a human on each shoulder that were dressed similar to her except that their clothes completely obscured their identities. This was just your luck. First Betty abducts and torments you for standing her up on a date and now there are burglars and one of them is a carnivorous anthro. Of all the terrible luck. You had to lay low.

You watch from your spot as the velociraptor makes her way to a painting of Zoonova and then moves it to reveal a safe with a padlock on it. She slips her human accomplices into the lock to pick it from the inside. You'd wake Betty but she's probably still mad at you and it might only make things worse. Heck, if that burglar saw you, you'd probably be in worse trouble.

You hear a clicking sound and the raptor is already robbing Betty's safe. To make matters worse...
1432122111222.title: The Break-In

14321221112221.content:
You see the raptor woman pull something out of the safe, holding it up to her face. You can’t see what it is, but by the excited whispers she exchanges with her cohorts, it must be valuable. She bends down to stuff the loot into a sack—

Thump! her plump rear hit a bookcase, jostling it against the wall. The raptor woman freezes, her human cronies leaping off her shoulders to a desk…as Betty begins to stir.

Oh Jesus, you think; this will NOT end well.

Betty snorts groggily: a thunderous noise from someone so huge. “Dang it, Alan; I was havin’ a darn good dream.” She sits up, her rump crushing down on you as she rubs her eyes. “Stop strugglin’; I’ll let ya go in…the…mornin’?” The cow giantess trailed off when she spotted the black-clad raptor woman ransacking her safe.

There was a moment of silence as both giantesses froze. From your limited view under Betty’s rear, you could jus barely see the human robbers scramble behind a stack of books on the desk.

“What in tarnation—what are ya doin’?! THIEF!” Betty snarled, bounding out of bed and taking a boxing stance. You think you hear her snort a challenge, but her movement tosses you about on the bed and the pain from being sat on for so long leaves your head spinning.

You recover in time to see the raptor woman put her claws up and hiss, showing a mouth full of formidable fangs. “Don’t try anything stupid, missy. We’re here for your money, not your life. Don’t try and be a hero, or you’ll get cut, got it?” She flicked her claws, and they glinted in the moonlight coming through the window. “And so will that poor sap you’ve been flattening under your fat ass all day.”

Betty snorts steam. “Miss; yer one stupid Dino. Ya shouldah waited till I wasn’t home to rob my place. Ya shouldn’t have tried and steal from a heifer, either…and ya REALLY shouldn’t have THREATENED TA HURT ALAN!”

She bellows a sound that’s half-roar; half-moo and lunges at the raptor burglar, throwing a wild haymaker. The dinosaur woman blocks, but Betty dodges her own vicious slash; knocking over the bookcase the raptor bumped into earlier. Both giantesses threw punches, kicks, and even a few hip-checks, trying to use their plump figures to advantage, but they seemed evenly matched as they knocked against walls, cursing and snarling all the while.

It was like watching two powerful goddesses slugging it out, and you had a front row seat.

The scuffle was getting heated—Betty barely dodge another claw-swipe that left deep gouges in the wall. Despite how the cow giantess had flipped out on you, you prayed she could win this…
14321221112221.title: Cow VS Dinosaur

143212211122211.content:
Betty and her dino opponent both went for a grapple, locking their arms and trying to push each other over. In the dark, you see Betty’s muscles ripple under her spandex bodysuit—turns out she has some strength under her bovine girth. Despite the raptor woman’s efforts, she and Betty were evenly matched.

“Come on, Betty! You can do it! Kick her scaly ass!” You cheer, and see Betty smile.

“Heh, see that? Even after I squished him with my big rump he still likes me,” Betty quips to the raptor woman. “Now, ta deal with you, ya sidewinder!”

Betty twists out of the grapple and delivers a knee to her foe’s stomach. The dinosaur woman’s eyes bug out and se lurches forward, clutching her belly with a groan. Betty looks back at you, and you just barely see her wink at you. Then she knocks the stunned raptor woman into the wall with a hip-check, putting her huge butt to use once more—this time on a fellow anthro. The dinosaur woman slams into the wall with a thud, not far from the safe. Before she can recover, Betty grabs the safe’s door…..

And slams it into her saurian foe’s face.
You wince in sympathy. Robber or not, that HAD to be painful.

Her snout bloodied and flattened, the raptor woman collapses to the floor in an unconscious heap. Betty smirks down at her.

“That’s what ya get fer messin’ with a heifer.”

She gets another two whips from her closet and quickly ties the raptor’s feet and hands. She’s turning to you when she spots movement on her desk—it’s the two humans who came in with the raptor woman!

“Aha! Was wonderin’ where you two went,” Betty says casually, grabbing them in her hand. She licks her lips. “Well, down ya go.”

Ignoring their screaming, Betty opens her mouth wide, holding the two men over it. She lets them scream and beg for a few more seconds…and drops them. The giantess cow’s maw snaps shut, muffling the robbers’ screams. She swishes them around for a moment, letting out a quiet moo as she enjoys the taste.

Then, as casually as if she was eating candy, Betty tilts her head back and swallows them whole.
Betty sighs and pats her plump belly. “Mmm..tasty!”

She gives her stomach another pat as she walks over to the bed, gently picking you up. “Are ya alright, Alan?” she asks, concerned. “Did any of those varmints get to ya?” She nuzzles her cheek against you, cooing to calm you down.

“Uh…no, Betty. I’m, uh; fine.” You manage to say. Still stunned by what just happened. “I…wow, you were amazing! Where’d you learn to fight like that?”

“Took some self-defense classes back on Zoonova, when I was a calf. When I saw them breakin’ in, it just all came back.”

You glance at Betty’s stomach. “Okay…and those guys you ate—are they…y’know…?”

Betty laughs. “Oh don’t you worry none. They ain’t dead. Got four stomachs, remember? They’ll be fine: no acid in the first one. As long as they don’t get themselves in the second stomach, they’ll be fine.”

You sigh in relief. They may have been robbers, but nobody deserved to be digested alive.

Betty kisses you—which given her size, left you soaked in cow slobber. Not that you mind, you were safe now; both from the robbers and from Betty’s anger. “I think you’ve had enough punishment, Alan. Let’s go call the cops and get these varmints outta here.”

She places you on her shoulder and picks a phone off her desk..then makes a face before she can dial. Reaching jnto her mouth, she pulls out a shoe—from one of the human robbers. You and Betty both laugh as she tosses it aside and dials the cops.
143212211122211.title: Betty Wins!

choices: "Where'd you get the dominatrix gear, anyway?"
"How about we go on that date, for real?"
1432122111222111.content:
You were sitting on Betty's shoulder when you heard sirens in the distance, along with the thundering footsteps of an approaching anthro. From your perch on Betty's shoulder, you can't help but nod in approval: for such a sleepy town, Coalton Shores' police were always quick and alert. "Heads up, the fuzz is here," you say, leaning against Betty's cheek.

She chuckles and nuzzles you, "Time to talk to the folks in blue, I guess." She smirks, "Hope they have a jail cell big enough for Miss Jurassic Park." After calling the cops, Betty had been sat on the still-unconscious raptor woman's chest, just in case she woke up. Despite the occasional twitch, though; the robber hadn't stirred. Her snout was bent at an odd angle and slightly bleeding. Betty really had done a number on her.

"I think they'll manage. You already have her cronies 'in custody'." You point at the cow giantess's plump belly. Muffled shouts can still be heard from within as the human robbers she ate keep yelling to be let out.

"Heh. Serves 'em right. All that strugglin' feels good." Betty gives you time to grab onto her hair as she slowly stands up and goes into the living room just as the sirens and footsteps get louder. There's a hard knock at the door--probably the anthro cop, from the volume.

"Coalton Shores Police!" A male voice barks. "Responding to a break-in report!"

"All clear, boys!" Betty announces. "Door's unlocked, come in!"

The door opens to reveal a burly deer anthro about as tall as Betty in a cop's blue uniform, his antlers being trimmed to not bump into doorframes. Two human cops are with him, one perched on each shoulder and wielding shotguns. The deer flashes a badge as he enters, "Officer Matthew Blake, ma'am. Where is--" he stops when he gets a good look at Betty's skintight dominatrix outfit, quirking an eyebrow for a second. The human cops try to hide smirks, but keep quiet.

You wince at their reactions. Betty had wanted to change out of her costume, but there hadn't been time. Thankfully, the cops are he's shrugging slightly before Matthew drops back into cop lingo. "Ahem. Where are the perps, ma'am? I understand there were three--one anthro and two humans--and you detained them?"

Betty nods. "Yessir! I beat up the raptor lady and tied her up as best I could back in my room. Slammed a safe door on her face, too; ya might wanna have a doc waitin' for her back at the station."

The cops chuckle at Betty's story. "Day-um!" the one on Blake's left shoulder quips. "That had to hurt!" He gets out his walkie-talkie and starts radioing more officers to come in and pick up the perps.

Matthew smirks in approval. "Serves her right if you ask me. Where are the human perps?"

You and Betty both crack nervous grins. "Well...she sort of ate them," you manage.

The cops all blink. "Ate them?" Matthew echoes. "I know they were robbing your place, but..."

Betty puts her hands up. "Woah, easy! I'm a cow--four stomachs, remember? There's no acid in the first one--those two sidewinders'll be fine. I can feel them throwin' a fit in there right now!"

Matthew looks septical, but shrugs. "I suppose that works. Just know we'll have to take you down to the station to cough them up later, okay? If they fall into the next stomachs and get digested, you could get smacked with an Excessive Force charge, or worse. That clear?"

Yikes. This cop was a hard-ass. When you saw Betty eat the two robbers, you'd almost felt like cheering. Hearing the potential consequences made you feel a bit guilty over shrugging off the two guys getting eaten. Betty's wince told you she felt the same way. "Yes sir," Betty says.

===A Bit Later====

As the cops filed away, Matthew handed Betty a yellow slip of paper. "And be sure to show up at the station at 9 A.M. on the dot, to spit up the two perps you ate. The Chief doesn't care how good they tasted, got it?" the deer cop says sternly. The raptor woman had already been taken away, Betty getting more odd looks when the cops saw the whips she'd tied her up with.

"Yes, Officer." Betty answers, patting her belly. "They won't be in there for too long."

Matthew nods. "Good. Have a safe night, ma'am. Oh, and about you snatching that young man's car off the road and taking him to your place?"

You feel Betty cringe. "Y-yes?" She croaks.

Matthew's stern face cracks a grin. "We're letting you off with a warning this time. Try not to do that again."
He turns and thunders off down the road, following the squad cars of the human cops.

Betty sighs in relief. "Good Lord, I was worried! I was so mad when I figured out ya fibbed, I didn't think straight! Can ya forgive me, Alan?" she says pleadingly, cradling you in her hands.

143321.title: A friendly Mink

14333.content: Maybe an Eastern Dragoness. Chinese style? Not like Sapphira.

143331.content:
You walk up and see the new neighbor anthro had a Chinese style home and rock garden. This must've been an Asian anthro. "What could they be?" you ask to yourself. "Panda? Snow Leopard? Crane?" You walk forward and then gasp. You see the new neighbor is a large golden scaled dragon, a chinese dragoness considering her long body shape, lack of wings and her antlers. She had green hair tied in green Chun-Li style buns and was wearing a white Chinese dress and blue colored eyes and lips.

You hesitate to speak with her because dragon anthros were very rare and there was only one other you knew about. Sapphira, a giant blue scaled European style dragoness. Sapphira was an evil anthro who despised humanity and was wanted on both Zoonova and Earth for terrorism. She burned down entire human cities and you heard rumors she even ate humans. She was a real life monster.

But this dragoness was a Chinese dragon and not a western dragon like Sapphira. She was most likely friendly. Maybe different types of dragons had different attitudes. But do you really want to find out? What's your choice of action regarding the new neighbor?
143331.title: Eastern Dragoness

choices: Bao Yu invites you into her house
You ask Bao Yu if she wants a tour of the neighborhood
1433311.content:
You figured that it couldn't hurt to check up on her. You thought that not all dragons were evil, so you walk into the yard just as the dragoness is walking by. "Excuse me!" you yell. "Excuse... Ah!" The dragon woman nearly steps on you before looking down. "Oh!" she yells. "I am very sorry about that. You must be my new neighbor." "Well, one of them," you say. "My name's Alan." "I am Bao Yu. Please to meet you." Bao Yu holds down a claw and you nervously shake it.

"Sorry," you say. "We don't see too many dragons around here." Bao Yu nods her head. "Dragons are rare even on Zoonova. There aren't a lot of us. It's more surprising here on Earth because your dragons went extinct years ago." "Hold on? Dragons really existed. Oh, sorry sorry." You then turn to see everyone who passed Bao Yu's house, both human and anthro were looking at her in caution.

Bao Yu lets out a sigh. "What's wrong?" you ask. "Dragons aren't the most popular creatures on Earth or Zoonova. Because of one particularly evil dragon." "You mean Sapphira?" Bao Yu nods her head. "Sapphira is giving us dragons a bad name. Just because she's an evil human hating creature of pure destruction doesn't mean that all dragons are bad. Western dragons are the worst." "I get it," you say. "It's like in mythology. European dragons are mostly evil while Asian dragons are good."

Bao Yu smiles and nods her head. "You have it Alan."
1433311.title: Welcome her to the neighborhood

14333112.content:
"Hey Bao Yu," you say. "I have an idea. Why don't I show you around the neighborhood? I'll introduce you to my anthro friends." Bao Yu bows and smiles. "I'd be honored Alan." Then this titanic Eastern dragoness lowers her head and you climb up her snout before she flies up into the air.

You look down and see that you must be twenty thousand miles off the ground. You're fascinated as Bao Yu flies forward. You only knew one flying anthro and that was Meena, but you never flew on her so you had no idea what it was like to fly atop an anthro giantess." You walk up to the tip of Bao Yu's nose and hold out your hands. "I'm king of the world!" you yell. "Sorry Bao Yu. A little human humor." Bao Yu lets out a laugh but then looks down in despair.

Several anthros, including that wolf Baxter look up at Bao Yu and rush inside. Bao Yu lets out a sigh. "Just as I suspected. They're all dragon phobic. Even other anthros don't like my kind." Bao Yu sounds so sad. You had no idea how subject to prejudice dragons were. Most of it was Sapphira's fault for being a dragon and causing trouble for both humans and anthros. Not all dragons were evil. At least there was one good one.

"Ah, we're here Bao Yu. This is my neighborhood." Bao Yu flies down and lands her feet on the ground without making a single noise. "That was so awesome." "Why thank you," says Bao Yu. "All dragons can fly, even without wings." Bao Yu then lowers her head and you run and slide down until you reach her shoulder. Bao Yu lowers her head until it is right beside you. "Come on Bao Yu," you say. "I want you to meet my neighbor..."
14333112.title: Chinese Dragon in Town

choices: She has company coming and asks you both to leave
143331121.content:
"Meena." Bao Yu however gives a look of concerned. "Are you sure that's okay Alan?" asks the Chinese dragon giantess. "Dragons don't really have the best reputation with Sapphira and anything." You leto ut a scoff. "'Don't worry. Meena isn't prejudiced as far as I know and besides, it's a different type of dragon that's the heel. Bao Yu snorts happily and breathes out a slight ember as she continues to fly through the air. "There it is." You say.

You point down to Meena's house right to the side of your own house. You and the humongous bat girl live so close together that you're literally in her own yard given your size differences. Bao Yu is surprised at this as she flies down and lands feet first outside of Meena's fence. "You didn't tell me that she's your next door neighbor? Most humans wouldn't be living to live so close to an anthro." "Uh," you mutter as Bao Yu lowers her head and drops you in her hand "I'm not like most humans.

Bao Yu walks up to the door and knocks on it with her tail. Meena opens the door and lets out a grunt because for some reason she isn't wearing her glasses. Meena had very bad eyesight like a lot of members of her species and had to wear a special pair of glasses. "Hi Meena." You say. Meena lets out a grumble and then puts on her glasses. But as soon as she does this, she spots Bao Yu smiling at her and screams. She even begins to hold her chest. "Alan?" she asks. "Don't you know that's a dragon over there?!" "Don't worry," you say. "Bao Yu is friendly." Bao Yu lowers her head and bows to Meena but Meena is still untrusting. "Meena," you say. "European dragons are evil. Asian dragons are good. At least that's how mythology works."

Meena is hesitant but Bao Yu holds out her hand and Meena gives a nervous smile before shaking it. It would seem at this point she finally sees the Asian dragoness means no harm. "I is an honor to meet you Meena," says Bao Yu. "Would you mind if we came in for a brief visit."

But you decided to give her the benefit of the doubt. After all you can't expect anthros to be tolerant if humans aren't. Plus all that nasty stuff people say about them must be only an unfair stereotype, right? You finally get to her house, it's colossal to you but normal sized compared to the other houses next to it. You ring the bell, put on a smile and wait for her.

The gigantic door creeks opened, and forward came a truly titanic dragoness. She had shiny crimson scales on her back, with smooth black plates on her stomach region. She had a massive rack and wore a fancy red dress with two holes in the back out of which her giant wings were poking out. She was barefoot, showing off her giant 5 toed reptilian talons. She was overall gorgeous, even compared to the other anthros you knew.

Lucy looks down and...
14333231.title: A gorgeous dragoness...

143332311.content:
You look up at her and say "Nice to meet you i'm". "Oh, for god's sake!" she roars in frustration. She then proceeds to crouch down and extend her hand towards you. Before you could react the five scaly digits of her hand closed around you, trapping you in her fist. You feel your stomach go into your feet as she lifts you up to her face. You gather the courage to open your eyes and you realize that you're standing on her open palm facing at her furious face, you could see the disdain burn in her crimson eyes.

"Look human, I've had just about enough of this idiotic, ignorant and downright plebian neighbourhood and now you just waltz on over, your mere presence being enough to get me to the boiling point!" She says in a voice your greatest enemy would threaten you in. You really screwed yourself over this time, but as you cursed your poor decisions the dragoness closed her eyes, took a few breaths and said."You're going to help me relax... whenever you like it or not."

She then gets up, goes through the doorframe and furiously slams the door. As you saw her lock the door you realized in just how big of a mess you ended up in... But the question is what is her idea of "relaxing"?
143332311.title: ...and a mean one at that!

1433323111.content:
After making sure that the door is locked, she pinched the back of your t-shirt and dangled you in front of her face. No doubt trying to and succeeding to scare the hell out of you. "This city doesn't allow dragons to fly to their destination, "they disrupt the air traffic" says your rotund and idiotic mayor." She mutters angrily. "And so I, a noble dragon was forced to walk around like a commoner. Now my feet are sore from the walking. This is where you come in, you will massage and pamper my feet, OR ELSE!" She hisses.

You gulp down and nod silently. This lady was completely insane! Should have listened to your friends, and you thought they were joking when they said dragons are born with a superiority complex. But you weren't in a position to oppose her, you were on her turf after all and if you want to leave this house in one piece you better not anger her further...

As soon as she confirmed that you understood your task, she dangled you above her gigantic foot and suddenly released you. You let out a scream as you plummeted hundreds of feet. You land squarely on her sole, which luckily was much softer than her scaly body. You slowly get up, your feet slightly sinking into her smooth flesh. She was laying down on her belly with her soles facing upwards. You were standing on the giant, black island of flesh that was her pad, with five smaller islands representing her toes in front of you. You look behind you and you see her colossal rump standing as tall as a mountain. She raises her head, and with an anoyed glare she said "Stop staring and get to work! Or else you'll become a permanent decoration on the botton of my sole!"

Without much delay you got on your knees and started rubbing and massaging her sole. It was hard work, you had a lot of ground to cover and the stech was unbearable, it didn't help that her talons were radiating heat, making you sweat like a pig. Midway through she curls her toes in delight, almost making you plummet to the ground. After what seems like hours of hard work she suddenly picks you up and gets up. She dangles you like before only this time staring at you for a few seconds. You stay still, silently praying and awaiting judgement.

"You did good human, my feet are feeling a little better now" You smile, it was about to end, she was going to let you go so you could forget about this whole event and never come over again. So you better shut your mouth, unless you want to become my permanent property." She answered.

Your body started to shake with rage, you wanted to lash out, to rebel against her. But you couldn't. She could crush you like a bug this very instant, so you swallowed down your pride and you simply just stayed quiet looking at the ground. Lucy was visibly content in enraging you, as was evident by the smile that was shaping on her face. She then walked deeper into the house.

The outside of the house was unremarkable, but the inside was a whole different deal. There were fancy paintings of dragons and dinosaurs strung up across the hallway walls. You passed by a room that looked like a kitchen. She had a plethora of advanced, flashy and expensive kitchen apparels. After passing through several more equally blinged out rooms you realize that this "house" was more akin to a mansion. Lucy was a rich gal, living the highlife.

She finally stops in one of the rooms. It was a large room that appeared to be the living room. In the corners there were marble sculptures of well built dragons. On one of the walls there was a colossal TV that resembled a movie screen. In front was a glass table and right infront of that there was a large and comfy couch. Lucy proceeded to...
14333231112.title: She decides to keep you.

143332311122.content:
"For now we will just watch TV, rest up human you'll need the energy for later." She say ominously. She placed you in the middle of the table. Lucy then sits down on the couch and lays back. Without warning she slams her right foot on the table, missing you only by a few feet. You recoil back from the shock, you have no time to recover as her left foot follows soon. You find yorself betweer the two, crimson soles of your dragon captor, both of them as tall as skyscrapers.

She was reveling in making you feel puny and insignificant. But you weren't going to give her the satisfaction. You ignored her teasing and simply looked forward. You would not let these two giant, scaly talons stop you from having a little bit of rest. Lucy who was dissapointed that you were ignoring her, picked up the remote from under one of the pillows and she proceede to surf the channels in search for something interesting.

It was all in the zoonovan language... you couldn't understand a lick of that giberrish and you weren't asking her to turn on the subtitles, lest you wan't to make her angry again. Well there goes the fun part, might as well skip to the next chore. But then you got the bright idea to ask Lucy a question.
143332311122.title: Sit down and watch TV with you.

choices: You comfort her abou her loss
She gets pissed, because you made her cry.
1433323111221.content:
You turn back, facing her you ask "Hey Lucy how come you're this rich". The dragoness looks at you with a dumbfounded look on her face "Do you really not know?" She asks. You silently sway your head. She sighs and utters "You humans... your lack of basic knowledge never ceases to amaze me. Allow me to educate you in Zoonovan history." You sit down on the glass table, preparing to get bored to death.

She clears her throat and starts the lesson "For millions of years the Draconic race had control over some of the largest mineral deposits on Zoonova. And as such all dragons are rich and influential. I myself have a net worth of several billions and own 7 major brands, 109 factories and 542 ore mines back at Zoonova. The anthros back at Zoonova show us the respect we deserve, but here on earth they seem to have forgotten the proper manners. The best part is that I don't have to do anything, everything is automated by my orderlies and I get almost all of the cash" She declares proudly.

So all dragons are rich apparently. That would kinda explain her discriminative nature considering everyone in the neighbourhood has average income at best. Wait... does that mean that Sapphira the rampaging, dragoness terrorist is actually a multi-billionaire? Your curiosity gets the best of you and you ask "So Sapphira is also filthy rich?"

Lucy's smug and proud expression quickly went sour as soon as you mentioned the infamous anthro terrorist. "Sapphira... don't even mention that name in my presence! She squandered her entire family fortune so she could for a gang of similarly shallow minded individuals and for what? To destroy your race. She is a disgrace to dragons everywhere!" She states. But then her furious grin disappeared into a saddened one?

"We used to be... friends. No, we were more than just friends. She was the only other dragon in my home town, we played together, went to school together, we were inseparable. We never liked humans, but we didn't downright hate them. But one day she went too far. She left her old life with me behind her. I've been trying to do the same, which is why I came here, to start a new life. She even went as far as to changing her name. Sapphira is not her real name, It's Alice."

You sat there, procesing all of this new information, when you noticed something. Tears were rolling down Lucy's crimson cheeks. You felt kinda bad for her, sure she was an elitist dragon with anger managment issues and she kidnapped you, but she's going through the loss of a loved one and you just reminded her about that loved one. What happens next?
1433323111221.title: Her motivations revealed.

14333231112211.content:
You figured out that by sympathizing with her she would let you leave sooner, and as much as you don't want to defend Sapphira you say "Look i'm sure Sapphira or Alice, cares about you. She cut contacts with you so you wouldn't get prosecuted by the law". Through tears Lucy says "If she cared about me at all she would have never become a terrorist in the first place!". The gigantic dragoness calms down and wipes the tears off her face. She picks you up and she holds you on top of her palm and says.

"I'm... i'm sorry human. I shouldn't have lashed out on you and I shouldn't have taken out my frustration on you. I will no longer hold you here against your will". Would you look at that, it actually worked! Being nice was your ticket out of here. But then you look out of the nearby window and you notice it's already night. It would be a real bad idea to go home at this time, lest you want a nocturnal anthro thug to make a smack out of you. You could ask Lucy to stay over for the night, but you don't want that to bite you in the ass later.

"Hey uh, can I stay over for the night." you ask, attempting to not sound assertive. The crimson dragoness smiles and says "I can do that for you, but don't tell anyone, or i'll squish you like a grape" you let out an awkward laugh as you're not sure if she's joking or not about the last part. But never the less she got up and started heading upstairs.

She finally got to her bedroom and it was just as fancy as every other thing in her mansions like house. The room had a pink, king size bed that looked comfy as hell. She gently places you on the bed, the moment you make contact with the cotton sheet you sink down a few meters due to the extreme level of fluffiness. She turned around, opened her dresser and started undressing herself, you being the gentleman you are, looked away. After hearing her close the dresser you turn around only to see her in only a bra and panties. You recoil back in shock, afraid she'll punish you for peeking at her.

Thankfully she wasn't angry. Apparently she was sleeping like this. "So where am I actually going to sleep tonight, as comfy as the bed might be I don't want to get crushed accidentally." you say. "Don't worry I have a plan..."

What is this plan.
14333231112211.title: You comfort her about her loss

choices: No way, you want to go home.

"I've got you covered" she says as she picks you up by your shirt, she then hoovers you ominously over her massive rack. You start to wail frantically, prompting her to giggle and say "Don't worry, we dragons are soft where it matters." She then proceeds to drop you, after a short fall you get lodged firmly between her giant breasts. She wasn't lying about the soft part, it was real comfy and it felt like her breast were radiating with heat. It was just warm enough to add to the coziness.

You slept like a baby that night. When you wake up you notice your not between her warm breasts anymore, you were laying on some smooth and cold object. Still feeling groggy you rub your eyes, when you open them again you realize that you're in the kitchen, in the middle of an empty table. Lucy was sitting in front of you, dressed in jeans and a yellow keyhole sweater. She had replaced last night's warm smile with her usual grumpy grin.

" I wanted to clear things up a bit. Last night I let my emotions get the best of me. Do no expect something like that to happen again" she says "I am a dragon of my word though, I will no longer force you to stay here." You take a sigh in relief, you thought she might go back on her words. " I do however have a proposition. I will allow you to stay in my house and guarantee your general safety, but only if you agree to always listen to my orders, to never disobey them no matter how outlandish and most importantly. Do. Not. Annoy. Me." She says. "It's your choice, either go away and never come back or stay in my mansion indefinitely" Lucy says.

Nervous now, and a bit sorry for such a weird first impression, you...
