"N- Not exactly... I wa-was... ummm... wanting to have it a 'Welcome to the Neighborhood' sort of deal... if... you kno-know... if you want." you replied sheepishly. The dragon chuckles as she nuzzles you again.

14421.content:
You turn your head and see that this anthro, this 10,000 mile high anthro was a giant dragoness. She had bright blue skin and a long neck. She was a European dragoness judging by her large leathery wings. This dragoness woman was noticeably overweight, you're guessing at least four hundred pounds had she been a normal sized human. She also had bright red hair that looked like a combination of a mullet and an anthro and had huge horns on her forehead, similar in shape to a crown. All she was wearing was a red A-shirt and miniskirt with a belt and she looked plenty angry. She was looking around and before you could say another word, she covers your mouth, shoves you in her cleavage and flies off with you before anyone can see her.

"What's going on?" you ask your captor. She just breathes out a slight ember to tell you to keep quiet. Soon, this dragon woman, this giant obese blue dragon woman takes you to the outside of the city. "Good," she says. "We're all alone. This dragon woman looks down and sees you outside of her cleavage. You had managed to slip down to her stomach area and tried to hide behind her belt. You tried to inch your way to the tail and climb down, but the tail wraps around you like a python and you let out a groan before you're lifted up in front of her face. This dragoness bears her enormous teeth and sniffs you before giving a look of disgust. "Wretched humans," she said. "I don't know why I'm even trusting you." "Wh-What do you mean? Who are you?"

The dragoness breathes fire above your head and you're forced to duck. "Remember my name human," she said as she tightened her tail grip on you. "I am Sapphira." You then let out a gasp. You heard of Sapphira, she was a nasty anthro terrorist who despised humans with a passion. She was the leader of a gang that hated Mayor Bloomberg even more than you do. But why oh why did a dangerous criminal want you.

"Please, let me go Sapphira," you say. "I actually like anthros. Please don't kill me." "Oh I'm not going to kill you, as long as you do as I say." You gulp loudly before Sapphira explains and turns her head to a dartboard covered in photographs of the mayor. She breathes out several flames to melt the dartboard to the ground. "There is going to be an anti-anthro rally in town today. Unknown location. Only a human can find it. That, my little friend is where you come in." Oh no. You were going to be an unwilling accomplice. You shudder at the thought of Sapphira's plan as she strokes your head with her finger and presses you against her enormous belly.

You notice a strange button on the top and reach to touch it as Sapphira looks down on you. "I wouldn't do that if I were you. That bomb contains enough power to kill ten anthros." You gulp loudly and shake. You're holding a dangerous experimental bomb.

"There's been too much heat in this area, I'd send Ruby or Emerald but an anthro would pick up unwanted attention. You will go to the rally, set the bomb and then run out fast." Sapphira then pulls down her shirt to reveal a large necklace made entirely out of human skulls that sends a chill down your spine. Some of the skulls still have stains of blood on them. If you didn't do what she said you'd be nothing more than a bead on that bloody jewelry. "I'll be good."

You look up to see that the anthro standing up in front of you was Ryan, a husky anthro who worked at a video rental store you go to. Unfortunately you never return the movies on time and Ryan resented you for that. Ryan looks down on you and lets out a growl.

"Oh, Ryan," you say. "What a pleasant..." "Pleasant nothing!" yells Ryan in that Russian accent of his. "You're two weeks overdue with movie!" "Ryan, this is not the best time. I have to be somewhere else." Unfortunately Ryan looks down on you and sees the disk shaped bomb. From his perspective it looked like a DVD. "There it is!" 1442112112.content:
You let out a sigh. There was no use reasoning with Ryan when he's like this. You're gonna have to get another bomb from Sapphira and you doubt that she'd be happy about giving you another one. You let out another sigh and go to the outskirts of town. "Sapphira!" you yell. "Sapphira! Are you out there?!" It was there you hear stomping and look up at angry glowing eyes. You had to jump back to avoid a stream of fire.

"Don't call me like that you idiot! I'm a wanted criminal remember! I trust you delivered the bomb?" You let out a nervous laugh as Sapphira lowers her head down and gives you the evil eye. "Uh funny story. Um, a husky I know confiscated the bomb under the impression that it was a late DVD and well..." Sapphira was so mad she breathed fire at you and forced you to duck as she blew smoke from her nose. "You incompetent insignificant worm! Do you have any idea how hard that bomb was to assemble!" Sapphira lets out a snarl and takes out another bomb that she tosses at you and forces you to catch.

"This is your last warning human! Your last chance! That is the last bomb I'll ever give you. You lose that one and I will devour you!!" You tremble. That was some threat. You knew that an anthro could swallow several humans whole easily but they never thought about doing it. Sapphira was making no idle threat. Nearby a jogger is rushing by, a human jogger who sees the smoke from Sapphira's breath and comes to investigate. He lets out a gasp as he sees Sapphira. But before he can warn anyone, Sapphira spots him and grits her teeth and grabs him with her tail.

As that jogger screams loudly, Sapphira tosses him up into the air and snaps him into her mouth before swallowing him whole. You look in fear as Sapphira turns at you and lets out a snort. Now you knew she wasn't kidding and you nervously run off. You're in big trouble. If you don't deliver the bomb, Sapphira will eat you alive. Now you need to reach the anti-anthro rally now more than ever.
1442112112.title: Going back to Sapphira

choices: You get the heck out of there
14421121121.content:
By some miracle you make it to the rally. It was going to be held in secret at the local high school and the podium was already set up for the mayor's speech. Fortunately nobody was there yet so you had time to set the bomb and activate the timer. You set the timer to give you just enough time to escape before it blew. You didn't want to do it but if you didn't you'd have to have your mail delivered to Sapphira's city sized stomach. After seeing what you did to that jogger you knew she wouldn't hesitate to down you as well.

You set the bomb and let out a gulp. "Have mercy on me." You say as you get ready to leave.
14421121121.title: You reach the rally

choices: The bomb goes off too soon
144211211211.content: Just as the rally is about to start, you run out of that human high school as fast as you could. You don't want to be there when the bomb goes off. Once you're in a safe distance you realize that the meeting just started. Hopefully it will take half an hour before the bomb goes off and maybe somebody will find it in that time. Heck, Mayor Bloomberg isn't even there yet. But with your terrible luck, something can still go horribly wrong and by horribly wrong you were afraid it was the type of horribly wrong that would land you inside a dragon.
144211211211.title: You get the heck out of there

1442112112112.content:
As you're trying to run off, you hear a loud explosion right behind you. "Oh crap." You say as you look back. You see the high school in ruins. The bomb went off too soon. Perhaps you didn't set the timer as good as you had hoped. You decide to hide behind a tree as the police show up.

Mayor Bloomberg of course is furious because he knew that the only possible reason for what happened was a terrorist attack. "Blasted beasts! I'll bet those oxygen wasting anthros did this! They're out to exterminate us, I just know it!" "I don't think it was an anthro," said a police officer examining the wreckage. "If it was there'd be evidence. Footprints for one." "And an anthro wouldn't need a bomb to destroy the school," said another cop. "More likely it was a human." "An anthro sympathizer!" yells the mayor. "When I get my hands on him, he'll be behind bars for life for this treason!

This was very bad. That Sapphira was going to get you thrown in jail. Even if you get away from the police, you'd have one very angry flesh-eating giant dragon on your hands. You have to get home fast.
1442112112112.title: Too soon

144211212.content:
The anthro that stepped in front of you was Brian, a giant arctic wolf anthro who hated humans. Well, not to the extent as Sapphira, but he acted as if humans were evil and he had stepped right in front of you as you let out a scream. "Hey! Watch where you're going!" Baxter then looks down on you and realizes you're here. He lets out a growl. "You again!" he yells. "Get lost human! We don't like your kind around here!" "We live in the same neighborhood Baxter, it's you who doesn't like me. Get off my case, I've got enough problems with anti-human anthros tonight."

As you try to run off, Baxter sees the bomb you're carrying and not knowing what it is, it peaks his curiosity. He puts one hand in front of you and knocks you down as you hold onto the bomb. "What's that you got there Alan?" asked Baxter. "A little old to be playing with toys aren't you." Baxter picks the bomb up and begins to inspect it to your horror.

"Baxter no!" you yell. "Don't touch that! It's a bomb! I got it from Sapphira!"
144211212.title: Baxter

choices: You visit Baxter in the hospital
You get a phone call (It might be Sapphira)
1442112122.content:
"Yeah right human," says Baxter as he keeps pressing at the bomb with his huge fingers. "How dumb do you think I am?" "I'm not kidding Baxter! Sapphira gave that bomb to me to blow up the mayor. Give it back before you trigger it!"

But it was too late, the bomb already begun to beep as Baxter gives a confused look. "Why is your little toy beeping?" "BOOM!!" As Baxter lets out a scream, the bomb literally blows up in his face. "Baxter!" you yell. In no time at all the arctic wolf has hit the ground with a crash.

You panic. Baxter may not be your favorite anthro but you couldn't leave him to die. Without a second thought you take out your cellphone to call 9-1-1. Soon Baxter is rushed to the hospital. The next day, you get a call from a nurse. "Your friend is lucky to be alive," she says. "That bomb could've killed him." "Yeah, I know." You shiver. Baxter was almost killed and it would've been your fault. Man, how did you get in such a situation. You realize that if you hadn't run into Baxter, you would've been responsible for a lot more deaths. What are you to do now?
1442112122.title: BOOM!

14421121222.content:
Suddenly, the telephone rings. You let out a gulp. It might be Sapphira. You don't even want to think about how she got your number if in fact she did, but she no doubt knows the bomb plan failed seeing as the mayor isn't dead. You know that if that is Sapphira on the phone, she's probably royally pissed off with you and no doubt planning to torture you for failing her.

You don't want to, but you summon up the courage to walk up to the phone. "Please don't be Sapphira, please don't be Sapphira, please don't be Sapphira."

It's...
14421121222.title: Ring, Ring, Ring

choices: Wait one month and meet with Sapphira
144211212221.content:
You gulp loudly as you pick up the phone. "Hello?" you ask. "Don't hello me human!" "S-Sapphira! How did you..." "I'm the one asking questions here worm? Why did the bomb go off before you even reached the rally?!" "Come on Sapphira, cut me some slack, Baxter was the one who set the bomb off."

"I don't want to hear any of your excuses! Thanks to you, the authorities are looking for my gang! You brought the heat down." "I'm s-sorry." "I'm giving you one last chance, there's going to be another rally in another month. They'll be looking for bombs, so instead I'll give you a device that will release a poison gas harmless to anthros, but lethal to humans. There had better not be any snafus this time, or your skull will become a permanent part of my jewelry collection. Understand."

"Y-Yes Ma'am." With that you hang up. One month until judgement day. You're in big trouble. If you fail again, Sapphira will kill you. What are you to do?
144211212221.title: When a Dragon Calls

choices: The police arrive at your door
144211212222.content:
"He-Hello?" you ask. "Hey dude!" yells a voice on the phone. "Reggie!" The hyena woman lets out a wild laugh. "Did you hear about what happened to Baxter last night?" "Duh Reggie. I was there." "I heard you were the one who did it to him. Dude. I know he hates you and all, but isn't that, I dunno harsh. Not that it wasn't totally sweet. I heard he triggered himself, what an idiot!"

As Reggie lets out a laugh you tremble in your seat. "Where'd you get the old village killer anyhoo? You got a bug in the black mark." "No Reggie. Sapphira gave me the bomb." Reggie lets out another laugh. "You can't be serious. Sapphira ain't around for miles. She's a dragon for crying out loud. She's stand out like a sore thumb here on Earth. Her race is even scarce on Zoonova. Don't go dragon down someone else for your mistake." Reggie laughs at her own joke but you let out a sigh.

"I'm not kidding. Sapphira gave me the bomb to blow up the anti-anthro ral..." "Dude. If I had a bomb, I'd be blasting that rally myself. It's about time the mayor's rants blew up in his face. You're a real card Alan. Oh, big rave at Sunder's tomorrow night. Hope to see ya there." Reggie lets out another laugh before she hangs up.

You let out a groan as you put the phone away. What could possibly go wrong now.
144211212222.title: A Friendly Call

1442112122222.content:
As soon as you hang up with Reggie, you hear a stomping noise and gulp loudly. "I really hope that sound is Meena." But it was no such luck because you heard a rumbling. Somebody had torn off your roof. It was a giant red furred unicorn anthro with a bright red colored horn. She looked as heavy as Sapphira and she was giving you an evil look. You try to run but this mastodonic unicorn picks you up by the leg screaming.

Then things get much much worse. You hear more stomping and turn to see Sapphira and let out a scream. She was pissed. So much that she was already fuming smoke from the nose. She lets out a loud roar and you think you might've even wet yourself. "You little worm!! Not only did you fail to destroy the rally, injured an anthro and lost my bomb, but you had to blab about it!!" "H-How did?" "Simple, I had Ruby here put a listening device outside of your house when you were supposed to be delivering the bomb.

You begin to sweat as Sapphira breathes more fire into your face. You scream as she even leaves third degree burns and singes off your clothes. "Come on Sapphira! Why pick on me?! I'm just one human! Ah!" Sapphira breathes fire on you again. "Silence! You see these skulls!" Sapphira holds up her necklace again. "How many of them do you think used to be stoolies like you." You shudder as Ruby squeezes your leg and makes you scream. You really shouldn't have talked about Sapphira behind your back. You're toast, literally. It would take a miracle to save you.
1442112122222.title: Bugged

14421121222221.content:
Sapphira knocks you over, and put a single claw on your pant leg, easily pinning you down.
You struggle to get free.
"Don't fight it," Sapphira snarled down at you.
Ruby was circling you with a look that terrified you. "Ready to die!?" She lifted up her terrifyingly huge hoof high above you, and brought it down.

Now, in retrospect, it should've killed you... SHOULD'VE... If the gods had been kind, it would've! But no, you weren't.

You felt a dull ache. When you look down at yourself, your right arm is gone.
14421121222221.title: Sapphira and Ruby torture you

144211212222212.content:
"I can't believe it," says Sapphira. "He's still alive." "That's odd," says Ruby. "I could've sworn I stomped him into putty." "How many times do I have to tell you to get your eyes checked Ruby," growls Sapphira. "We have to snuff out this human quick. He already told his friend we were here and pretty soon we'll have the police to deal with. Do you have any idea how easy it would be for them to spot anthros like us? We're not exactly normal animals."

You grunt and try to get up but it's no use, you just lost an arm and couldn't hold your balance. You're in complete horror, your right arm was nothing more than a smear on Ruby's sole. These anthros really were trying to kill you. Of all the creatures you had to run into it had to be Sapphira. What horrible luck?

Ruby and Sapphira were trying to think of what to do with you next. "I have an idea," said Ruby with a vicious look. "How about I bite off the rest of the limbs and chew him up like gum." You begin to twitch. Ruby wasn't Sapphira's second in command for nothing. Even though she was supposed to be of an herbivorous species, she was infamous for eating humans and she was looking at you with hungry eyes.

Sapphira gives a sinister smile Ruby's way. "You always suggest that. But perhaps we should try a form of torture he's more familiar with. Sapphira blew smoke out of her nostrils and you scream. This was bad. These two anthros were discussing how they should torture you.
144211212222212.title: No One Could've Survived That

choices: Sapphira stops to catch her breath
One of your neighbors calls the authorities.
1442112122222122.content:
You hold your stub of an arm in pure pain and then look up in fear as those monsters finally decide what to do with you to test how durable you really are. Sapphira opens her mouth wide and inhales deeply and you realize that only meant one thing. Dragon breath.

"No!" you yell. "Don't!" Ruby steps out of the way right before Sapphira unleashes a torrent of flames that strikes you and makes you scream in pain. Your body is being so burned that you feel like you're gonna be charred any minute. Sapphira just had to be a dragon of all creatures. Her fire breath was her main weapon to deal with humans and many human cities were reduced to ash by those flames and the flames were so severe that your house even began to catch a spark.

But your house was getting off easy, you were being bombarded with a steady stream of dragon breath and you felt pieces of your skin begin to chip away. This was a nightmare and Ruby chanting "Burn! Burn! Burn!" sure didn't help that matter. If nothing was done, you would die, if you were lucky. But Sapphira just keep blowing out flames as you continue to scream.

When will this nightmare be over?
1442112122222122.title: Dragon Breath

14421121222222.content:
You're in serious trouble. You shudder as Sapphira breathes more flames at you. "No human betrays Sapphira," she says. "You're going to fry for your treachery." It looked as though Sapphira would roast you alive, but next door, Meena is washing dishes when she smells the smoke from Sapphira's breath. Out of curiosity, she looks out the window and lets out a gasp as she sees Sapphira and Ruby both attacking you. "Oh no!" she yells.

Without wasting any time, Meena reaches the telephone and presses all the buttons for 9-1-1 as fast as she can. "Hello?" asks a woman on the other side of the line. "This is an emergency," says Meena. "Come quick! Sapphira is right next door to me and is going to kill my neighbor." "Sapphira?! Are you sure?" "Who'd kid around about Sapphira? Come quick, listen careful... I'll give you the address."

At this moment you're on the ground and both Sapphira and Ruby have one foot on you and are threatening to crush you. Ruby lets out an evil laugh as she presses her moon sized hoof on you. "I just love it when they squirm." She says. But Sapphira stops and takes her foot off of you as she raises her long dragon neck into the air and puts a hand to her ear. "Sirens?" she asks. "Somebody squealed." Sapphira turns her head, and Meena ducks under her window before the dragoness can find her. Meena is shaking in her seat, knowing she ratted out the most dangerous anthro on both planets. Sapphira and Ruby stop torturing you as several anthros in riot gear arrive accompanied by humans in tanks. "Stop right there Sapphira!" yells the leader, a one eyed panther man. "You're surrounded." You breathe a sigh of relief.

Ruby gives a concerned look but Sapphira just gives an angry look before wrapping her tail around her unicorn accomplice. "True," says Sapphira. "But, you're forgetting just what kind of anthro you're dealing with." Sapphira extends her wings and flaps them, taking both her and Ruby away as the police try to shoot at them. But soon enough Sapphira and Ruby have escaped. You breathe out a sigh of relief and then Meena walks out. "Are you okay Alan?" she asks. You nod your head up and down. "Thanks Meena. I owe you one." Of course, you're not over with this issue yet because the police are walking towards you and the panther man Shadow comes forward.

"Alan," he says. "We need to speak." You let out a groan. "If this is about what happened with Baxter. That wasn't my fault. I was trying to blow up the ral... oh, that didn't come out right at all." "We're not talking about the bomb." Says Shadow. "It's not like you're the first human old lizard lips has bullied into helping her." Says a lioness policewoman. "You're safety is at risk now that Sapphira knows you tried to rat her out. I'm afraid you can't stay on Earth."

Meena's eyes popped at that thought. "You mean you're relocating him to Zoonovan. Are you sure that's a good idea?" "We have no choice citizen. Sapphira will never think to look for a human on the anthro planet, which is why first thing in the morning your neighbor is going on a trip to the anthro version of..."
14421121222222.title: Whistleblower

choices: An oblivious anthro sits on you (survive)
144211212222221.content:
You blink your eyes. "There's a Japan on Zoonova." "A-Actually," says Meena. "For every country on Earth, there's a s-silly country on Zoonova. It's bizarre. Kaishidu is what they call it." You don't know about this and bite your fingers. "It will only be until Sapphira has been captured," says Shadow. "Its for your own good. The next plane for Zoonova will leave tomorrow. You'll live with an anthro native who will make sure nothing happens to you."

You think about it and then you let out a sigh. "It appears I have no choice." Meena gives a sad look. "It won't be easy saying goodbye Alan." "Oh Meena." "Oh, this isn't goodbye," says the lioness policewoman. "You're going with him." Meena gives a look of shock and drops her jaw. "You were the one who blew the whistle after all. Your life is in just as much danger as your human friend's." "B-B-But, I... I've never been anywhere on Zoonova except for Gothopolis where I was born. I..." "Come on Meena," you said. "At least you won't stick out like a sore thumb. Come on, we've got to get packing."

The next morning, you have just finished packing and then you hear Meena pounding on the top of your house, accidentally breaking it apart. "Oops." You let out a sigh. "That's okay. After what Sapphira and Ruby did to it, this was bound to happen. Let's get to the airport.

Meena picks you up and puts you in her cleavage before she picks up her own bags with her feet and flies away. You reach the airport and get in the plane to Kaishidu, the anthro Japan on Zoonova. You're placed in a seat next to Meena. Meena didn't seem to like leaving Coalton Shores any more than you did. It wasn't Zoonova, but it had been your home.

The plane is just getting ready to leave. You let out a sigh. "At least the worst is behind us. Meena however doesn't seem to think so.

What happens next?
144211212222221.title: The Japan of Zoonova

choices: Meena and the cougar get into a fight
1442112122222212.content:
Before the plane could even leave the ground, you hear tremors. You'd think you'd be used to them given how often you're around anthros, but then you feel the tremors coming closer and you look up to see an anthro girl coming right towards you. She was a giant puma woman, slightly bottom heavy with strawberry blonde hair and a pair of thin glasses similar to Meena's own. She was also wearing a pink suit and tie. She was took busy looking over some papers in her briefcase to see you and before you knew it, you saw her pink rubber covered rear coming down on you. "Oh hell no." You say.

Before you could say anything else, this puma giantess sits her moon sized butt on you and you're trapped. It was the softness of the seat combined with her rear that prevented you from being squished and you were instead pinned to the chair and couldn't move. You groan and try to get the attention of this puma woman, or Meena, but your voice was muffled by puma cellulite.

Fortunately Meena turned her head around. "Alan?" she asks. Then she sees the puma woman on top of you adjusting her glasses and realizes what happened. "Uh excuse me." The mountain lioness pauses and turns to Meena with an annoyed look. "What is it." "I think you're sitting on my friend." Naturally the puma woman gave a look of disbelief. "You're joking." "Actually no, my friend is a human and..." The puma gives Meena even more disbelief in her eye. "A human going to Zoonova? That's a laugh. Listen, I need to be on Zoonova as arepresentative for the Silver Liberty Tourism Bureau of Earth. I would prefer it if you didn't annoy me with fantasies of humans on the plane and left me to my work."

The puma even growls at Meena slightly to make her back off. You grumble to yourself as you try to get out from under mountain lioness behind, but it would appear your only hope to get out of this situation was Meena. Too bad Meena was as timid as they got and it would appear that the cougar intimidated her. Could you really expect a shy bat to stand up for you.
1442112122222212.title: Cat Ass

choices: The plane lands but you're stuck to her skirt
14421121222222121.content:
Meena decided to back down. She didn't want to get on a fight with another anthro and the plane was just taking off. It wouldn't be a good idea, even if her friend, namely you, was pinned to the seat by the cougar's ass. You let out a groan as the puma wiggles her behind and causes you intense pain. That fat cat didn't even know you were there and it ticks you off. She could've looked to make sure nobody was in the seat. But then again, who'd expect a human to go to Zoonova. Meena just lets out a sigh and twiddles her fingers as she hopes for the best. "I'm sorry Alan." She mutters under her breath.

You try all you can to make her feel you and get her attention, but that cougar is sitting on you so hard you can't move. It's lucky there's a soft cushion beneath you or you'd be squashed into a red smear. You can barely hear anything but the plane takes off and it is headed for Zoonova, to Kaishidu, the anthro version of Japan. You were going to spend the whole plane trip with a cougar sitting on top of you. That was hell.

As you mumble, you decide to bite this cougar woman. But the woman is completely oblivious and is adjusting her glasses as she looks over the papers for her business meeting. What was she numb. You're in an utter nightmare and you're woozy due to the lack of oxygen. You sure hope this plan lands soon.

Suddenly...
14421121222222121.title: One Long Plane Ride

144211212222221212.content:
Soon enough the plane lands in Kaishidu, the Japan of Zoonova. "The plane has landed. Everybody out." Everyone gets up, even the cougar woman who sat on you. You let out a sigh of relief, believing the nightmare was finally over. But then as the mountain lioness gets up, you get up with her and you see that you're stuck to her skirt like gum. "Oh no." You groan. You try to shake free but you're still stuck and this pear shaped mountain lioness walks out of the plane.

You hope that Meena will notice you're gone since she's the only anthro who knows you're stuck. But before Meena could go after the cougar woman, several anthros walk by and she can't get up. "Oh no," she says. "Just hang in there Alan. I'll get you when I can."

As the cougar woman is walking out with you stuck to her ass you look out and see Kaishidu and see that it's in the style of....
144211212222221212.title: Stuck to Her Skirt

1442112122222212121.content:
As the giant puma lady got up from her seat, with you basically glued to her titanic bosom, you managed to dislodge your head a little. You looked around a little, all around you there were tons of anthros each different and totally oblivious to your situation. Beyond them there were skyscrapers taller than anything you could imagine possible all littered with glowing neon commercials. The language was neither Japanese nor Zoonovan but some strange mix.

Yep, you were in Kaishidu alright. Now the question is, how do you get off giant cougar before she reduces you to a red stain? You tried struggling as much as you could, but to no avail. You were lodged deep into her pudgy, left buttcheek. You sigh, guess you're along for the ride. You couldn't spot Meena among the crowd of other anthros, you could only pray she manages to find you. On the bright side, the fresh air upon your back was very refreshing. Sadly that wouldn't last long as the oblivious Puma entered...
1442112122222212121.title: Modern Japan

144211212222222.content:
You blink your eyes. "There's a France on Zoonova." The lioness nodds her head. "Interestingly enough, for every country on Earth, there is a counterpart on Zoonova. We believe that in a way Zoonova is a parallel to your planet." "At any rate," says Shadow. "You're gonna be relocated to Gaulos for your own safety." Meena then realizes something. "Allen," she says. "Lalonde is from Gaulos. I heard she was planning a trip to visit friends and family up there. Maybe she could take you to Gaulos."

You hesitate considering Lalonde the sheep giantess did have a tendency to treat humans more like little dolls than people, but at this point you had no choice and you let out a sigh. "If I must." Shadow and his lioness assistant then nod their heads and walk away before Meena takes you in her hand and flies you off to Lalonde's house across the street and rings the bell. You hear loud tremors from Lalonde's footsteps and the 10,000 mile high sheep girl opens the door.

You see her wearing a tight red outfit that exposed her large breasts as she flows her bright pink wool. "Bonjour Meena." Says Lalonde. Lalonde then notices you and lets out a swee as she pushes you into her monster sized breast and pushes you to her nipple as you grunt. "Alan! Quelle surpris magnifique! What brings you here you cute little human?" You grunt and moan and then Lalonde takes you away from her breast as you finally catch your breath. "Je suis desolee Alan."

"Lalonde," you say. "I have a favor to ask you. I need you to take me to Gaulos with you?" "Quel?" asks the French sheep titaness. "Pourquoi." You shiver. "Sapphira is after me. " "What?!" yells Lalonde. "Cette dragon monstrueuse. You poor thing." "Yeah, I have to be relocated to Gaulos. So, could you possibly let me come along for the ride. "Oui, oui," says Lalonde all too happily. "But, there is one condition. I decide where you ride." "Fair enough." You say with a gulp. You knew you were going to regret this. You just knew it.

Where is Lalonde going to keep you for the ride to the France on Zoonova?
144211212222222.title: C'est La Vie

1442112122222222.content:
Lalonde blushed as she looked down at Alan "I want you in here"she said with her accent and pointed in bettwen her legs "I've always wonder what it would be like to have a human there"she said as she picked Alan up and pull at her skirt before she dropped him into her lacey thongs that's pushed him up against her puss

Alan pov
Alan didn't know what to say but he did promise and he watched as he was dropped in side
1442112122222222.title: In her underwear

14421122.content: But which girl is it?
14421122.title: One of the girls

144211221.content:
"Hi Alan." Says Meena. You look up in surprise because you see your next door neighbor Meena, the shy giantess bat girl. She was wearing a T-Shirt bearing the Avengers logo on it and was adjusting her glasses as she looks down you. It would make sense if Meena was out this late considering she's a bat.

"Oh, hi Meena, I can't talk right now. I've got to get to the rally." As you try to run off, Meena gets a nervous look on her face. "The anti-anthro rally? That's not like you Alan. You're not anti-anthro are you? Was it something I said?" You don't answer and just keep running but Meena flaps her wings and creates a gust of wind to blow you down. You lose your grip on the bomb a couple of times before grabbing it again. You let out a sigh. Sapphira wouldn't like it if the bomb went off and didn't kill the mayor.

"Alan?" asked Meena. "Please tell me why you're going to the rally."

You could tell Meena the truth, but you'd put her in danger but you didn't want to make up a vicious lie and hurt her feelings. Why did you have to run into Sapphira?
144211221.title: Meena

choices: You turn back to apologize to Meena
1442112212.content:
You don't want to say what you're going to say, Meena has always been so nice to you. But if you told her the truth and Sapphira found out, she'd put on a contract out on Meena for being a witness. You couldn't put your friend's life in danger, so you have no choice but to be cruel in order to be kind. You swallow and prepare to tear her apart.

"Shut up bat face!" Meena lets out a gasp. "You are so annoying! Do I have to tell you freaks of nature everything I'm doing! What do you care, you're nothing more than animals that can talk! You mutant freaks are destroying our planet and driving us to extinction! I hate all of you! You've taken over my neighborhood and boxed me in! Lalonde treats me like a doll, Baxter is always angry at me even though I never even speak to him and Reggie's music has probably given me permanent hearing damage! And you, you're the one who irks me the most, always flying over my head and never talking to me! And with your annoying obsession with pop culture that might I add we humans made! I'm surprised you don't live in your parents' basement! I never want to see you again!"

Meena hears every word and her eyes water, fogging up her glasses before she runs away crying. "You're so mean! I thought you were my friend!" As Meena runs off sobbing, you feel absolutely horrible. Even if you didn't mean those words, you shouldn't have said them. You knew they weren't true and you knew they weren't right. You want to make it up to Meena but you still have the bomb that Sapphira told you to deliver. You really wish you never ran into that dragon. Why couldn't she have abducted somebody else?
1442112212.title: A vicious lie

14421122122.content:
You feel horrible. Meena was your next door neighbor and a good friend and you hurt her feelings and made her cry. You decide that even though you are carrying that bomb for Sapphira, you had to apologize and explain yourself.

You run after Meena as she's on the side of the street still crying. You walk up to her and then you let out a groan. "Meena." You say. Meena looks down and then she folds back her wings and begins to tremble. "Wh-What do you w-want? Please don't hurt me? You've done enough telling me you hate me?" You let out a sigh. "I don't hate you Meena. And I don't hate anthros. I didn't want to see you hurt but I hurt you anyway." Then you show Meena the bomb. "What is that?" asks Meena trembling.

"It's a bomb." You say. "A BOMB!!" yells Meena as she flies up on a fence. "Where did you get a bomb?" You hesitate but then you tell her. "Sapphira." Meena screams so loud you have to cover your ears to avoid going deaf. "Sapphira?! That dragon is in Coalton Shores! Oh this is very bad. Alan, you shouldn't have told me. She'll kill you." "You think I don't know that." Meena then picks you up, placing you on the back of her neck and then flaps her wings like crazy.

"We've got to get help!" Meena flies with all her might and you hold on tight to the bomb. Although she hated humans, Sapphira would kill any anthro who sided with them. Meena had every right to be afraid and went immediately to notify the police.
14421122122.title: Apologize

choices: Meena manages to fly to safety
144211221222.content:
As you hold on tight to the bomb, Meena continues to fly ferociously. She knew that if she had to get to the police, it would be faster to fly. Unfortunately as Meena was halfway to the station, she crashes into something big and soft and you nearly drop the bomb as you scream and grunt. You catch the bomb and then you let out a sigh. "Careful Meena. This thing is dangerous. Why did you stop."

Meena tries to speak to you but can only mutter in fear as she has a look of pure shock on her face. You climb up on Meena's shoulder and then you gasp in fear because you see none other than Sapphira right in front of you both and she's pissed off. "You little squealer," she says as she blows smoke out of her mouth. "You dare double cross Sapphira!" Meena stammers in front of Sapphira and backs off before Sapphira lowers her head and glares at her. "So," she says. "Is this a friend of yours human? Then she's a traitor. All traitors must burn." Sapphira opens her mouth and is about to roast Meena alive, but you toss the bomb in Sapphira's face and the flames ignite it creating an explosion that distracts the dragon and makes her scream. "Fly Meena!" you yell. "Fly for your life!" Meena flies quickly in the opposite direction, almost dropping you in the progress before picking you up and flapping her wings at warp speed.

"S-S-Sapphira," mumbled Meena. "We actually saw Sapphira. I can't believe this, the most dangerous anthro alive is here in Coalton Shores. Oh no." "Don't panic bat girl," you say. "We can still get away." Meena is so nervous that she nearly loses her glasses and you didn't blame her. Sapphira knows she's friends with humans now and you're both in grave danger.
144211221222.title: Dragon Dread

144211222.content: Maybe that sexy fox woman Vixie?
144211222.title: Another Girl

1442112221.content:
As you're walking towards the anti-anthro rally you feel earthquakes and then you see that curvaceous fox (literally) neighbor of yours, Vixie jogging forward listening to her iPod. "Oh come on," you say. "Who goes jogging this late at night?" Before your question can be answered, Vixie jogs forward and nearly steps on you.

"Hey!" you yell. Then Vixie takes out her headphones and then looks down at you. "Oh, sorry Alan. I didn't think the humans would be out this late at night. Yech. All except for those neanderthals at the rally." "Uh yeah," you say. "Now, if you'll excuse me." You hold onto the bomb Sapphira gave you before Vixie steps her foot in front of you. "What's the rush little man?" she asks. "Come jogging with me."

"Ah!" you yell before Vixie puts you in her cleavage. "Comfy?" she asks. You struggle and try to squeeze your way out but you're in too deep, Vixie's bright red-orange fur as thick as tree trunks. But then Vixie realized something. "What is that you have?" Vixie reaches down and takes the bomb before you yell. "Hey! Give that back!" Vixie takes a closer look and lets out a gasp.

"Is that a bomb?! You were going to blow up the rally weren't you?" "How did you know?!" Vixie then picks you up and takes you up to her skyscraper sized eye. "Where did you get this bomb?" "S-Sapphira, that anthro criminal told me... she said... Ah!" But Vixie just takes the bomb and places you back into her cleavage. "So Sapphira is in Coalton Shores. Interesting. Very interesting. I'm going to have to report this."

Vixie zips you up in her jumpsuit before she walks away with the bomb. How the heck did Vixie know that it was a bomb in the first place? Outside you hear Vixie on the phone pressing buttons. "It's time somebody slew that big blue lizard." Who does Vixie call.
1442112221.title: Here comes Vixie

14421122212.content:
"Hello Chief," says Vixie on her phone. "This is Agent Reynard. Our suspicions were correct. The infamous Sapphira is here in Coalton Shores." "Very good agent," says a voice on the phone. "No doubt she is planning to attack the anti-anthro rally. Not that disrupting the rally isn't a good thing, but we can't let Sapphira kill any more humans. You remember what happened to Rhode Island." Vixie nods her head. "I know where the rally is and I've just confiscated a bomb. That bloated blue handbag tried to coerce one of my neighbors into delivering it."

Agent Reynard? Vixie was a secret agent. This day just kept getting stranger and stranger. You never thought Vixie was more than a pretty face but boy were you wrong. "Sapphira and her two top operatives Ruby and Topaz are on the top of our Agent Reynard," says the chief. "When they realize their bomb hasn't gone off. They'll attack personally. As soon as you see them, contact us immediately."

Vixie nods before hanging up. Then she unzips her jumpsuit and lifts you up to her eye before glaring at you. "Please don't arrest me. I had no choice." "I know. Sapphira can be very persuasive." "Vixie," you say. "You're..." "My name isn't really Vixie," says Vixie. "I am Rachel Reynard. Agent of Omnipol. The Zoonavan police and you just helped me slay a dragon I've been chasing for a long time. I better put you back away. Things could get real hairy for a little man like you."

Vixie or rather agent Reynard just puts you back into her cleavage deep, before she walks off to the Coalton Shores human high school. The auditorium is where the meeting is taking place and Reynard looks at her watch and gives a stern look. She knew Sapphira would arrive soon. You shiver in Reynard's cleavage. This has been one weird and stressful day and you want it to be over soon. The agent then hides behind a large building to get the drop on the terrorists as soon as they rear their ugly faces.
14421122212.title: Secret Agent V

144211222121.content:
As Agent Reynard lays in wait, she hears stomping and sure enough Sapphira comes towards the auditorium. She was accompanied by two other anthros, the main members of her terrorist gang. The first was Ruby, a titanic red furred unicorn with a horn that looked like it was painted in blood. She was Sapphira's second in command and was infamous for going against her species' herbivorous diet when it came to humans. The second was a yellow feathered griffin with a black colored head. Her name was Topaz and she was a complete psychopath who enjoys torturing humans in the most gruesome ways possible and rarely spoke in anything other than an insane laugh.

Sapphira lets out a grunt and blows smoke out of her nostrils. "I should've known better than to trust a human with that bomb," she groans. "They're completely useless." Ruby just gives an evil laugh. "Don't say that Sapphira," she says as she licks her lips. "They have one use. Oh, when we get to that rally, I'm going to swallow so many bugs whole." Topaz just lets out an evil laugh as she polishes what looks like an oversized potato peeler. "Kill humans," she says. "Kill the humans." "Yes Topaz," says Sapphira as she breathes out fire. "All humans in Coalton Shores, starting with that loudmouth anthro hating mayor of theirs will perish."

But just as soon as those monsters get forward, there's a large explosion that makes Topaz yell as she collapses on the ground in a cloud of feathers. "Topaz!" yells Sapphira. "What's going..." "Looks like your bomb blew up in your face dragon breath." You crawl deeper into Reynard's cleavage as Sapphira's eyes let out a look of surprise that quickly turn into rage. "Reynard!" she yells. "Hounding me as usual I see." The secret agent you once knew as Vixie simply opens up her tail to reveal she really a kitsune. "What's going on out there?" you ask. "Be quiet," says Reynard. "And hold on. This won't be pretty."

Ruby lets out a snort and drags her hoof through the ground several times before she runs at Reynard with her horn out. "Ruby!" yells Sapphira. "Look out!" Ruby tries to impale Agent Reynard but Reynard jumps into the air and swings all nine of her tails in Ruby's face to make her groan before Ruby crashed horn first into an empty skyscraper. Ruby tries to pull out her horn but Reynard forms her tails into a fist and whacks the evil unicorn in the back, causing her horn to break off.

As Ruby recovers, she feels her head and you peak out of Vixie's cleavage to see what happened. Once Ruby realizes the damage, she makes a face of despair and takes out a compact mirror before letting out a scream. "It seems you've been reduced to a mere horse." Says Reynard. Ruby lets out a snort as she lets loose tears of pure rage. "You broke my horn!" Ruby tries to punch Reynard but Reynard trips her and Ruby hits the street.

At this point, Topaz gets up and coughs up blood before she shrieks and holds up her potato peeler. She tries to cut Reynard with it but Reynard grabs it with her teeth before tossing back Topaz. Topaz then flaps her wings and flies up before swopping down and holding out her talons. But Vixie outwits Topaz by picking up a car and tossing it at the scar in Topaz's face. The car is lodged in and Topaz shrieks before she crashes into the ground and smashes the street to pieces.

Vixie or rather Reynard, smiles but then a stream of fire goes over her head and she turns to face Sapphira now madder than ever. "How did you find out about us in the first place Reynard?" asks Sapphira. "Let's just say," says Agent Reynard. "Don't use a courier that lives across the street from me." Sapphira breathes fire and three of Reynard's tail catch on fire before the fox girl waves them and then looks as Sapphira. "Cheater." Sapphira rushes at Reynard and swings her tail but Reynard ducks and then kicks Sapphira in her large belly.

But Sapphira bits Reynard in the shoulder with her sharp teeth to make her scream before tossing her through a skyscraper and making it shatter As Reynard gets up, she has to dislodge a truck from her side as Sapphira continues to breathe out flames. But then Reynard tosses the truck at Sapphira and it lodges itself in Sapphira's throat. As the dragoness is gagging, Vixie runs at Sapphira, all while you're bouncing around in her cleavage. "And here I thought I knew my neighbors." You say as you grab onto a thick strand of fox girl.

Agent Reynard then kicks Sapphira in the face and causes her to crash into the street. Sapphira flaps her wings to blow back Reynard before spitting up the truck and breathing more fire. Reynard has to move through the fire and use a big chunk of road as a shield. You're so hot in her cleavage combined with the heat of the flames and the heat of the fox fur, you stripe down to your underwear hoping Agent Reynard wouldn't mind.

Reynard and Sapphira grab each other by the shoulders and grapple with each other as they both hit the ground. You hold on tight because the fight gets really hairy. "Come on Vixie," you say. "You can beat the dragon. I sure hope Sapphira doesn't know I'm in here."

It's a grizzly fight between two city sized anthros. But who will win?
144211222121.title: Fox vs. Dragon

choices: Reynard wants you to join her as a member of Zoonova police
1442112221211.content:
Becoming a close ranged fist fight at this point, both anthro women back off, bleeding profusely as they stare each other down. Sapphira, being the first to move, throws her claw out and slashes Reynard's chest, exposing you and her cleavage. Sapphira was about to see you, if not for the fist flyng into her snout, breaking her nose and teeth in the process, and sends her flying onto her back. Quickly jumping onto her, Reynard doesn't gives a moment of rest and starts beating her down the dragon. From the frantic movement, you're thrown out and land near the unconscious body of Topaz and her gear. As Sapphira could see that she's going to be beaten, her hands swing around her opponent's neck and starts to choke her, distancing her from the dragoness. Due to Reynard's size, her arms can't reach the anthro terrorist and soon tries to pry the evil dragon's strong claws off her neck.
Shaking off the shock of being thrown, you see that Reynard is being choked and she's already blue, you panic, until you see a needle beside you, the size of a spear. Picking it up, you rush over to where the two titans are fighting and once there, you start to climb the dragon, who was more focused on Reynard than on you.
"What's the matter, little fox? Can't breath?" Sapphira taunts the kitsune, Reynard still looking at her with a determined look.
"That face pisses me off; in fact that your kind of people pisses me off! Believing that everyone is equal, when it's obvious that there isn't. Humans are inferior to us, yet you people believe that we should treat them the same as us. Suppose that even if you emerged victoriously, do you really think that the anti-anthro rallies would stop? In fact, this incident would inspire more to hate us and even more so. So, just die will ya! Let me snap your neck like the pathetic shit you are!" Sapphira monologues, as she finally goes for the kill.
"No, they'll hate you!" You shout as you plunge the needle into her eye and the dragons roars, letting Reynard's neck loose.
"You little piss ant! I knew you were trouble when I sent you to bomb that rally! I'll get you for this!" She roars in pain, as her claws cover her injured eye and starts to move her arm towards you.
Reynard, who was recovering from being nearly choked to death, pulls out a knife and gets up, as moves towards her downed opponent, kicking her arm away from you. The dragon howls in pain, as her holds her broken arm, before being kicked down to the ground. For the first time in her wicked life, she felt fear and soon spots the knife in Reynard's hand.
"What are you going to do with that?"
"For breaking multiple laws, such as murder, arson, terrorism, conspiracy, and violations of both human and anthro rights, of the first degree, you are sentenced with the death penalty, Sapphira Jewels!" Reynard declares, as she plants herself on top of the evil dragon, preventing her from moving.
"You can do this! Where's my trial? Can't I declare insanity?" Sapphira begs, for the first time in her life.
"Sorry, but you should taken your trial back a few years ago when you had the chance. Had you been on Zoonova, perhaps you may of had a small chance of evading the death penalty, but you're on Earth, aren't ya?" Reynard says, before plunging the knife into the monster's neck and slicing it open.
Sapphira's single eye stares at her with shock and despair before the light of life vanishes, along with the monster known as Sapphira. Reynard falls to ground as adrenaline stops going through her as both you and her Reynard stare at each other, filled with exhaustion.
"Is she..."
"She's dead, Alan. She's dead, though her legacy will live as a legend of terror and hatred towards dragon anthros," The fox states, as her tails merge into one.
"Let's go home, Alan. You had a busy day today, you deserved it," Reynard says as you nod your head, before passing out from exhaustion.


The next following days were eventful: your friends and family come by to check on you, eyes filled with tears as they feared for safety. Especially Meena and your mother, as they were balling their eyes for you. Even Ryan gave you a break, as he told you to hold onto the video for a bit longer. Your neighbors came by to check on you and gave you a 'get well' gifts. Meanwhile, true to Sapphira's words, Mayor Bloomberg used the incident as an excuse to fire up the anti-anthro activists, though the pro-activists protested things were repeating themselves, they themselves being fired up. After the fall of Sapphira and her top two trusted aides, her organization fell pretty quickly and made it easier to capture them. As for Reynard, not much was said of her, as she didn't come by nor her actual job being mentioned at all. For you, the days went by as a blur and the press were relentless on you, asking questions about your involvement. It was a dark evening as you were resting, when you heard a knock on your door and you go to open it, hoping it wasn't anymore journalists. Standing there, was your foxy neighbor, covered in bandages. You both awkwardly greet each other before falling into a long period of silence.
"You alright, Ms..." You ask her, being the first to break the ice between you two.
"You can call me Vixie as you always have, Alan. As for your question, other than having multiple injuries and tons of paperwork for me, I'm fine. How about you, Alan?" Reynard, no, Vixie asks, returning back to the personality she had before showing that she was a secret agent.
"So-so, but man, the media doesn't give you a break!" you complain, making the giant giggle.
"I know, but there's another reason for me coming here," Vixie states, as she reverts to her Reynard persona.
"Uh, what is it?" You ask, curious of her request.
What was it that Reynard wanted to ask you?
1442112221211.title: Foxy victor

1442112222.content: Maybe that cow girl Betty from the supermarket?
1442112222.title: Another Someone Else

choices: She places you in her mouth and heats things up
144212.content:
"You're insane! I'm not going to sell out my own town." You heard bad things about Sapphira and that she had a body count high consisting of both humans and anthros. You may be no fan of the mayor but Sapphira was the type of anthro who would kill anyone in her path no matter who her target was.

Unfortunately, Sapphira was going to get the information out of you one way or another and pushed you into her large stomach, practically asphyxiating you as she gave you an evil toothy smile. "Oh don't worry human, we have ways of making your kind talk. I'll find out where you're hiding your boss." Sapphira then gave an evil laugh and her eyes glowed as she showed you her enormous tongue. You're horrified at what this monster has planned for you.
144212.title: The Rat

1442121.content:
As you gaze into Saphira's razor sharp, fang filled maw, you are terrified!

"Don't worry, human, I won't use my teeth to rend an answer you. Although you're not likely to like the alternative any more! I will crush the answer out of you with my...
1442121.title: Crushing torture (Choice of Type)

14421211.content:
... massive foot!" With those words, she drops you into a bowl. "Let's see, how long it takes until you scream where they are." She then puts her feet into the bowl, placing them on top of you and giving you an incredible pain. She then starts to lift them up and down, slamming them onto you every time. You feel your bones break, one by one, cutting through your skin and organs, one of them being your heart. You die an slow and painfull death, but you know, that you just saved a lot of lifes!

But netherless, it's over!
14421211.title: Ups...

choices: a) want to be reborn (be anthro)
b) want to go to heaven (live with anthros)
144212111.content: You suddently wake up, every thing around you being white. You start to remember what happend. Sapphira, didn't she crush you, because you didn't want to tell her where the demo was? Wait why didn't you fell the pain? And why did you have the feeling that someone watches you? "Don't fear, my child" Who was that? "I am the maker of your race!" You looked behind you and saw a giant Human in front of you. "You did a lot of good things in your life, so I'm giving you a choice: Do you...
144212111.title: Good Karma

14421211111.content: Which Animal are you?
14421211111.title: Which Animal are you?

1442122.content:
You shutter to think what kind of evil torture Sapphira has planned for you. If you talked then anthro terrorists will destroy the town but if you don't talk, you're in serious trouble. Sapphira then proceeds to lift you up into the air and open her large fang filled mouth showing you her building sized teeth as she lunges her tongue out. You panic.

"Please don't eat me!" Sapphira lets out an evil laugh. "You're not getting off that easy. Either you talk, or you'll fry." Sapphira places you in her mouth and closes it tight. You pound on the fang walls but to no avail. This was not good, you're in the mouth of a giant terrorist and barefoot, you can feel that huge slimy tongue and you couldn't keep your footing.

However, things were going to get much, much worse before they get better. You smell something strange and foul. "Ugh. What smells like sulfur? Oh no!" You remember that this was no ordinary anthro you were dealing with, but a fire breathing dragon, and you had a front row seat to the fireworks. Before you can do anything else, the flames rise from Sapphira's throat and the red light burns your body. You scream but it didn't feel as bad as you thought. Sapphira isn't trying to kill you. She's trying to interrogate you. It's so hot you have to take off your clothes down to your boxers, but even that won't save you as you cough loudly. You remember something, fire needs oxygen and it was quickly running out with the intense heat. The smog sure didn't help. "Are you ready to talk yet?" asked Sapphira who was somehow able to speak with her mouth closed.
1442122.title: She places you in her mouth and heats things up

14421221.content:
Sapphira's flame breath is too much, any more and you'll be cooked alive and Sapphira wouldn't even have to open her mouth to eat you. "Alright! I'll talk. The rally is taking place at the East Coalton Shores High School! Tonight at seven o'clock. Just spit me out right now please!" The flames stop and Sapphira opens your mouth. You stagger to the front of her open maw to inhale a deep breath of fresh air before that dragoness picks you up and places you in her hand as she lets out a snort.

"You're a bright boy." Sapphira says as she pushes you against her giant belly. "You saved yourself from a fate much worse than being char boiled." You let out a sigh but then Sapphira tightens her grip and lifts you up to her face as she breathes on you, but this time without any fire. "Of course, you know our plan. Can I trust you not to rat us out?" "Yes. You can trust me Sapphira. Why would I double cross a multi mile high dragoness?" You let out a nervous laugh but Sapphira is still suspicious as she rubs you across her fleshy stomach. She's considering what to do with you.
14421221.title: You break down

144212211.content:
Sapphira thinks about her next decision long and hard and you're worried about her next move. Then she lets out a sigh and makes you choke on the smoke in her breath. "I suppose I could let you go. But don't you dare tell anyone about our plan. Understand." You nod your head before Sapphira tosses you aside. Thankfully you land in a tree and then land on the ground.

You let out a groan and shake leaves out of your hair. But then you realize that Coalton Shores is in serious trouble. Sapphira didn't take prisoners. She'd burn the city to the ground. You needed to get help. It takes you an hour to get back to Coalton Shores. You only have a few hours more to warn the town about the incoming danger, but there's no way Mayor Bloomberg would believe you. Especially considering that Coalton Shores was such a small town, people wouldn't think Sapphira would even bother. You needed to find a cop.

Fortunately as you walk into town, you see a couple of anthro police officers walking around town. You knew the police in this town well what with how small Coalton Shores was. The first of them was Kyle, an ankylosaurus anthro. He didn't speak much and was said to not be very smart, but he was still a cop. The second one was a female cop. Elise, a blue whale anthro. She was more human looking than most anthros, except for her huge tail and white underbelly and chin and the whole blowhole thing. She was the biggest anthro you've ever seen and you were someone afraid of her. But still, she was still a cop.

Which one do you go to for help?
144212211.title: Race Against Time

1442122111.content:
Elise was too big. You were much too scared of her to do anything to tell her. Kyle was the best bet. As you run up to Kyle, you have to dodge the ankylosaurus's clubbed tail. You begin to rethink your options when Kyle steps on a mailbox by mistake. "Kyle!" yells Elise. "Watch where you're going." "Duh, sorry Elise."

Oh brother, you forgot Kyle was the dumbest cop on the force. But still, Elise was so big she probably wouldn't see you, and you didn't know how she felt about humans. As Kyle swings his tail again, you jump on the club and climb up his spiky back. You run up to Kyle's, well, if he had ears. "Kyle!" you yell. "Kyle!" Kyle lets out a confused mutter and reaches into his pocket, taking out a device like a wiretap. "Duh. Hello? Hello?" Unbelievable. Not only did he mistake you for his radio, but he mistook a wiretap for his radio. What an idiot.

"Kyle! I'm up here!" Kyle turns his eye and finally sees you. "Duh," he says. "Alan? I didn't know you was a parrot anthro." You slap yourself in the face. Oh brother. What an idiot. "Kyle, listen carefully. There's going to be trouble in Coalton Shores." "Duh, trouble. You mean j-walkers. We ain't had those for months." "Terrorists!" "Is it Halloween already? I gotta go buy some candy." You slap yourself in the face. You just had to choose the big dummy. "Kyle. Sapphira and her goon squad are going to attack the town tonight."

Suddenly Kyle's eye popped. He was dumb but he wasn't stupid enough that he wouldn't recognize the threat of Sapphira. "Duh, this is serious. Come with me Alan. Elise! I'm taking a break!" With that Kyle stomps off carrying you. Where does he take you?
1442122111.title: Kyle

choices: Elise shows up and busts Kyle for treason
Sapphira shows up to punish you.
14421221112.content:
You're so relieved. You thought that Kyle would take you to the station so you could warn the force about Sapphira. You seriously couldn't leave Kyle to his own devices. Not with his pea brain. However, instead Kyle takes you into a dark alley. Had he gotten confused again. You just slap yourself in the face. "Kyle," you say. "I know you're stupid, but this isn't the precinct."

Kyle ignores you and reaches into his shirt to take out a cellphone. He presses a few buttons and puts it to the side of his head. "Hello?" asks a familiar voice on the phone. "Sapphira!" you yell. Kyle lets out an evil laugh. "Hey boss, you know that human who ratted the town out to you earlier you told me about. I just caught him trying to rat you out." You let out a gasp. You just hung yourself. "Oh really?" asks Sapphira in an angry tone on the phone. "I thought I made it perfectly clear. The rally can wait a few minutes, while I barbecue a little stoolie." Kyle lets out another laugh as he hangs up. "I'd love to see that."

You try to escape down Kyle's spiked back, but Kyle grabs you by the legs and holds you up in front of his face. "Captured by Sapphira and then busted by me. You're a very unlucky dude Alan." "I can't believe you! The dumbest anthro in all of Coalton Shores, a terrorist." "Nobody is that stupid," said Kyle. "Except for you squealer." "You're corrupt!" "Nuh-uh. I ain't no traitor. I was on Sapphira's side the whole time. How do you think she knew there was going to be a rally in the first place." You let out a gulp. You're in big trouble now. Sapphira is going to pulverize you for trying to rat her out. You can hear stomping already. Some huge anthro is coming around the corner and with your luck it will be Sapphira ready to roast you alive.
14421221112.title: Dirty Cop

choices: I'm going to eat you slowly, and painfully
I'm going to scorch you again!
144212211122.content: You're unlucky, because the stomping comes closer, rounds a corner, and Saphira appears! She looks angry. "Well, human..."
144212211122.title: Sapphira shows up to punish you.

144212212.content:
Sapphira lowers her long neck and blows smog out of her nose right into your face to make you cough. "I'm not taking any chances." She says. You gulp loudly and Sapphira reaches into her cabinet to take out what looks like a human sized birdcage. You struggle to break free of that dragon's grip but she then shoves you into the cage.

Once inside, she puts a lock on it, locks the lock and then places the key underneath her enormous tongue. "You'll be out once Coalton Shores is rubble. If I'm in a good mood." "And if you're not?" Sapphira lets out a growl and shows you her enormous teeth as you jump back. "Y-Yes ma'am."

Sapphira then takes out a cell phone to contact her gang. "Ruby, Topaz. We have our heading. We attack at seven. East Coalton High School. We're gonna show the humans that when you bully a dragon, among other things, you get burned." With that Sapphira hangs up and begins to walk away when she sticks her tail up in the air.

That huge obese dragoness turns around and eyes you in your cage as you bite your nails. "Can't leave you all alone can I?" she asks. "Uh, yes." You say weakly. Sapphira scratches her chin. She knows you're trapped, but like she said, she doesn't like taking chances. This was bad. Very bad.
144212212.title: She locks you up

1442122122.content:
Sapphira knows that you'd probably break the lock if you were left to your own devices, so she dials up on her cell phone again and places it up to her ear. You had a bad feeling about this. "Hello?" asks Sapphira. "Onyx? Are you there? Good. Listen. I've got a little stool pigeon here in a cage. We know where to strike, but I'd sleep better knowing that our little squealer doesn't escape and tell the police what we're doing. Good. Good. Come over right away."

You let out a groan and then you shake your head. You were in big trouble. Sapphira was going to post a guard to watch over you. Sapphira waits half an hour and then you hear a stomping noise that almost shakes your cage off the table before Sapphira stops you. "Ah," she says. "That must be Onyx. Come in."

You let out a gulp and into the room comes in Onyx. Onyx is a giant blackish skinned anthro triceratops with a large domed head and long hair that was a lighter shade of red than Sapphira's own. She looked shorter than Sapphira but she was still huge compared to you. "Keep an eye on him Onyx. I don't trust any human." "Right Sapphira." Says Onyx as she nods her head.

As soon as Sapphira leaves the room, Onyx stomps up to you and you look at her in pure fear.
1442122122.title: The Guard

14421222.content:
Sapphira's fiery breath was killing you and you felt like you were going to suffocate, but you wouldn't talk. "No!" you yell. "You'll never get me to speak you fat sadistic jerk!" Surprisingly Sapphira opened her mouth and let out the smoke and you can breathe again. You breathe in every bit of clean air you can get before Sapphira spat you back into her big scaly hand. She then brings you up to her moon sized eye and glares down at you. You should've known this monster wouldn't show you any mercy.

"Very well insect," she said. "Normally a human in your position would've either cracked, or burned. Now the real fun can begin." You gulp loudly as Sapphira slips you into one of the rolls on her belly. You can't move and you're completely stuck. You were coughing loudly due to the smell of dragon sweat. Sapphira sure goes to extreme lengths to choke you. But unfortunately for you, this wasn't the torture.

Sapphira takes out a strange communication device, she was going to contact one of her heinous accomplices. "I'm obviously going to need help to squeeze the life out of you. I'm going to call a friend of mine over. You'll wish incinerated you." You bite on Sapphira's flesh to try and escape but you're barely a mosquito compared to her. "Oh, so now you're going to bite me. You just bought yourself a date with me and..."
14421222.title: You refuse. Next torture.

144212221.content:
"Ruby?" you asked. "Who's Ruby?" Sapphira let out an evil laugh. "Ruby is my second in command. I call her whenever I want to have a little fun with uncooperative bugs." Oh man, things were going from bad to worse really fast. You were in the rolls of one giant terroristic anthro and now you were going to have another one on your head.

"Hello," said Sapphira on the phone. "Ruby. It's Sapphira. I've got one." "Have the little worm squealed yet?" "Not yet. He's stubborn." "You mean he's stupid. I'll be over right away." Sapphira hangs up and then fishes into her fat to pull you out. You try to hold on to avoid the torture but Sapphira managed to pull you out and bring you up to her evil smiling face. "Now you're in big trouble. You'll talk if you know what's good for you." At this point you think that squealing would be the best idea.

"Ah," said Sapphira as her door opened. "There's Ruby right now." Ruby was another unusual anthro. She was a giant unicorn, not as tall as Sapphira but getting there. She had a large glowing horn that looked as sharp as a knife and had slicked back spikey mane with red fur all over her body. She was wearing what looked like a white one piece loincloth and she was just as heavily built as her boss.

Ruby walks up to Sapphira and sees you shuddering in her palm and gives another evil smile. "That the rat boss?" asked the unicorn girl. "He will be. Once he gets a load of double trouble." Ruby wiggled her behind as she glared directly at you. "How do I get myself into this messes?"

How do they get the information out of you?
144212221.title: Ruby Doomed

1442122211.content: How will they crush you?
1442122211.title: Double Dose of Crushing

1442122212.content:
You're sweating in fear as both Sapphira and her second in command Ruby look down on you. But then you take a closer look at Ruby and then let out a laugh. You get a feeling this might not be as bad as you thought. It's a foolish thought, but you couldn't help but laugh at Ruby. "What's so funny?" asked Sapphira with a slight growl. "This is your second in command?" you ask Sapphira. "She's a unicorn." Ruby lets out a look of confusion that soon turns into a look of anger. "What's that supposed to mean."

Sapphira realized what you were thinking and gave an evil smile. "Oh," she said. "I get it. You're not the first to underestimate my Ruby. Ruby, would you be a dear and show our guest your horn?" Ruby lets out a laugh and walks up to her boss and bends down. You take a good look at her horn and realize that not only was it glowing but it was also bright red. You shutter because something tells you that it wasn't always that color.

Sapphira patted Ruby on the head and made her smile. "My Ruby is just as deadly as she is beautiful." Ruby then let out a giggle. "So Ruby, my lovely blood red unicorn, what form of torment would you recommend to pump the little worm." Ruby actually had to think about that and you didn't like the look on her face. Then she begun to giggle. "I know the perfect thing Sapphira. We'll give him the Six Tick Kiss." Sapphira was actually impressed. "Ooh," she said. "We haven't tried that for a long time. Good idea." Sapphira liked that idea and logically, that meant you were going to hate it, whatever it was. "What is the Six Tick Kiss?"

Sapphira and Ruby both laughed evilly and you begun to shake. "You see," said Ruby with a giggle. "We both kiss each other, except you're in our mouthes at the time." You give a look of disgust. "That's the torture." Ruby just gave an evil smile and showed you her teeth. Being a unicorn they weren't sharp as Sapphira's but at that size even herbivorous teeth can be frightening. "Wait, it gets better." Sapphira decided to continue where her lover left off. "We also play tug of war with our tongues. Whoever has you in their mouth at the end of the tug of war, gets to eat you." You let out a scream and then turn to Ruby. "But unicorns are vegetarians!" Sapphira just gives you a smug smile. "You don't know Ruby at all." "Oh relax," said Ruby as she looms her face over you. "You'll be thrown back up in an hour, that'll give you enough time to think about whether you want to fink or not. You're too important to us to melt." Ruby and Sapphira let out another laugh and then decided to get it over with.

Sapphira placed you in her cavernous mouth again as Ruby kissed her. At the intersection of the maws their tongues wrap around you and each other. You grunt and groan as both behemoth terrorists toss you around with their tongues. You're living a nightmare, they're like pythons trying to squeeze the life out of you. You couldn't think of a worse torture but then you remember that whoever pulls you into their mouth first will eat you for an hour and then regurgitate you. At this point being digested would be a blessing.

Who wins the tug of war.
1442122212.title: Double Trouble

14421222122.content:
As you let out a scream, one of the tongues pulls you into a mouth. By the flat grinding teeth, you could tell it was Ruby. You couldn't believe two things. The lengths they'd go to interrogate you, namely the fact they'd eat you alive. The other thing you couldn't believe was that you were going to be swallowed by a unicorn, a creature that wasn't even supposed to eat meat.

You struggle to break free but Ruby's tongue is too big and pulls you into the throat as you let out a scream and Ruby gulps you down. Outside Ruby feels her neck to feel your descent as Sapphira wraps her tail around the unicorn's leg and gives a lustful smile. "A growing girl needs to eat." Ruby gives Sapphira a smile before letting out a slight belch.

Once inside Ruby's stomach, you're completely horrified. You're standing on an island of human bones in a sea of acid. Sapphira wasn't kidding. Even though Ruby was an animal that was supposed to be herbivorous, she was an outright predator. You could even swear some of these skulls were children's and shiver. You have one hour of this to look forward to and the island of bones was slowly dissolving. You gag on the stench of stomach acids and decomposing bones. It was even worse than Sapphira's fire breath. Then things get much worse because Ruby shakes her hips and rocks the stomach. You scream and nearly get hit by a wave of acid. Sapphira has her head to Ruby's stomach and both of those titans laugh at your misery.

It goes on like this until the hour is over and Ruby gags a few times to send you back into her mouth panting heavily. Ruby opens up to show your tortured form to Sapphira and Sapphira gives a wicked smirk your way. "Now are you ready to talk, or would you rather be unicorn cud? I'm sure Ruby can think of another way to squeeze the life out of you." Ruby licks the top of your head as you bite your nails. Morality or not, your puny body couldn't take any more torment from these two terrorists.
14421222122.title: Not so Herbivorous

144212222.content:
As soon as Sapphira was off the phone, she pulls you out of her fleshy prison and you look up at her evil visage as she lets out a sinister laugh. "I just called Topaz, she'll be over here in a heartbeat, unfortunately for you." "Should I be afraid." "Very much so little man. Topaz is the most destructive creature we have in the alliance. When she gets though with you, you'll spill every secret you've kept since you were a larvae." Oh, you really don't like the sound of that.

And as much as you were going to hate the sound, the reality would be much worse. Topaz came in and you got a good look at the new torturer. She was an anthro griffin with clawed talons for hands and large wings on her back. She had black feathers from the neck up and on her back and her lower lion body was covered in yellow fur. She had yellow green hair and her face was covered in scars. She was laughing insanely as she held up a duffle bag, presumably full of weapons to torture you in ways far too grizzly to describe.

"Break," muttered Topaz. "Break human. Break." Oh man, this was worse than you thought. This griffin girl wasn't just insane, she was downright feral. Sapphira must have a real crew of monsters.

As Topaz went through her bag to find something to torment you with, Sapphira smugly looks down on you and licks you to add insult to injury. But then she decides to be generous and offer you a deal. "There's still time to surrender right now human, tell us where the anti-anthro meeting is right this minute and you can skip Topaz altogether." What will you do now?
144212222.title: Topaz

1442122221.content:
You may not like Sapphira's plan, but you look at Topaz and she seems all too excited about the idea of torturing you as that griffin anthro was laughing as she went through her bag. You knew if you angered Sapphira again, you'd be done for, so you had no choice but to chicken out.

"You win!" You yell. "I'll talk! I'll talk! The rally is taking place at the wharf, in the back of a fish cannery! The mayor called a secret meeting in an informal location to avoid terrorists! I'm not lying! Cross my heart!" As you cringe, Sapphira looks down at you and gives an evil smile before stroking your head with one of her giant claws. "Now that wasn't so hard was it."

Topaz however isn't as happy as Sapphira and lets out a groan. She wanted to torture you. "Calm down Topaz," says Sapphira. "You'll get to rampage to your heart's content when we get to the meeting." Topaz gives an evil grin, if she had teeth she'd show then right now. Sapphira then places you on the ground and kicks you slightly with her giant leg to push you across the floor. "Get lost human," she says to you. "We don't need you anymore. And don't you dare tell anyone you saw us or..." Sapphira then gestures her finger under her neck to give you the picture. You gulp and run away. "Call Ruby and the girls Topaz," you hear Sapphira say. "Tonight we paint Coalton Shores red with human blood."

This is trouble, big, big trouble. You ratted out the meeting to the most dangerous anthro on two planets. In a way this is your fault. What will you do. You could tell the police but A) You'd risk going to jail yourself and B) Sapphira would put you on her revenge list. All they could find of the last poor sucker to rat on Sapphira's gang was a single skull. Maybe you could skip town, but would you really abandon Coalton Shores because of a terrorist attack?
1442122221.title: Better Talk than Torture

choices: The fight's in the favor of the authorities
You look up to see Sapphira stomping towards you, rage in her face
14421222212.content:
You knew that you were going to regret this later on, but morals wouldn't allow you to leave Coalton Shores in the claws of such terrible creatures. You whipped out your cell phone, dialing as fast you could, bringing it up to your ear, shaking a little. This was something really big. Lives were at stake."Hello? This is 9-1-1, what is your emergency?"A female voice answered on the other end of the line. You couldn't tell if it was an anthro or human answering the phone, the officials had both working on it now.

"Y-yes..."You gulp."I would like to report...something really big."

"Could you repeat that sir?"

It's Coalton Shores, a really small mining town. Y'know Sapphira, that really terrifying anthro criminal? She's going to attack the town...tonight."

"Sir...are you serious?"Her tone questioned you.
