"Please...just send someone. Lives are at stake here...human and anthro."You shuddered. It was true. Even though Sapphira fully thought anthros were the superior species, she was known to kill her own kind who sided with the humans.

"Very well, we have squads heading that way sir. Thank you for your call."

You thanked her back and flipped the phone shut, looking off into the distance. It was going to be one hell of a night for such a tiny town.

---

By the time you had arrived back in Coalton Shores via bus(For Sapphira had taken you to another town not too far away), things were already heating up. Earthquakes rattled the planet from twenty anthros stomping across the landscape, their massive feet bulldozing the ground beneath into paste. Smoke rose up from the human side of town, and you could make out Sapphira and several of her cronies around her gleefully torturing the small humans below.

You felt sick.

But, more stomping and groundshaking. You looked off to the horizon, only to see hope. Several anthros clad in riot armor or police uniforms were heading for the terrorists, backed up by tiny human tanks by their feet and fighter jets buzzing around them to aid in any way possible.

There was about to be a big showdown in Coalton Shores.
14421222212.title: You Notify the Authorities

144212222121.content:
As the fight broke out, the authorities had the upper hand, they had several strong anthros on their side and Sapphira's flunkies were taken out one by one. A cerberus anthro on Sapphira's side was the first to fall and at the hands of a tiger anthro while a mountain lion cop held down a phoenix anthro long enough for a tank to strike him with knockout gas. One dingo anthro cop had trouble with a pegasus anthro but a lioness anthro came to his side and knocked the pegasus out. You watched from a safe place as even the destructive Topaz was knocked back by a large tortoise anthro. As her opponent turned his back on her, Topaz took out a giant knife and tried to stab him but was shot at by an attack jet in the face. The griffin anthro shrieked loudly as the tortoise man turns back and pins her to the ground, breaking her wings.

Soon, only Sapphira is left and she is not giving up without a fight. That horrible dragon easily makes short work of the human tanks with her intense flame breath and as a couple of jets fire at her, she crushes them in her hand as she gives an angry snort. But then the leader of the riot squad appears, a tall black panther anthro in green armor with a mullet and a red eyepatch walks forwards to confront Sapphira. "Shadow." Mutters Sapphira. "Your rampages ends now dragon," says Shadow. "You're under arrest." Sapphira just breathes a huge torrent of flames at Shadow as you let out a scream. Shadow however holds up a shield to block Sapphira's flame breath. "I'd like to see you try!" yells the dragoness.

It's time for the deciding battle. Shadow rushes at Sapphira as she continues to breathe fire but then he jumps into the air and fires at the dragoness, forcing her to use her large wings as a shield. Shadow kicks at Sapphira and manages to land a blow to her face before she responds by biting him in the arm. Shadow scratches Sapphira in the face and then slashes her across her large chest. Sapphira breathes fire again and this time Shadow is in the direct range of the fire. But he endures and delivers punch after punch on Sapphira's face and manages to knock out a few of her fangs. Sapphira scratches Shadow but he holds up a paw to protect his good eye. You bite your nails as you watch the assault. The remaining tanks try to help Shadow but Sapphira knocks them away with her tail before flying up into the air to get an advantage as she continues to spew flames. But Shadow just jumps into the air and grabs hold of Sapphira as they wrestle in the sky.

Sapphira attempts to breath fire but then Shadow grabs her by the mouth and stops her. All Sapphira succeeds in doing is burning her own mouth before Shadow grabs her by the wing. Sapphira shrieks as Shadow pulls her to the ground. Shadow turns Sapphira around so she's in direction of the crash. The two anthros fall to Earth with a massive quake strong enough to blow you several miles across the ground screaming. Looks like you didn't choose a safe enough spot. But as you get up, you see that Shadow has triumphed as the rest of the anthro cops come to his side. "She's unconscious. Hold her down until the armored car comes. She's still dangerous."

Soon, an anthro sized armored convey appears and you look up at the sky and let out a yell of victory as you pull back your fist. Good has triumphed over evil. Sapphira has been defeated and you had a hand in it.

The next day you're listening to the radio as you wash dishes and you hear a report about last night. "Last night was a dark night for Coalton Shores. The infamous Sapphira and her gang arrived at an anti-anthro rally and attempted to destroy our town. At least one hundred humans were severely injured, including our own Mayor Bloomberg." "Only injured? They could've at least killed that jerk." "But fortunately, the same human tortured into giving the location of the meeting to Sapphira notified the police who made short work of the evil anthros. Coalton Shores was saved from a terrible fate." You turn off the radio and smile to yourself. Sapphira was finally behind bars.

You think everything's over, but then you heard a tapping on your roof, you had company and it sounded like anthro company. You decide to go to the door to see who's there.
144212222121.title: Good Triumphs Over Evil

1442122221211.content: But is she Sally or an anthro?
1442122221211.title: It's a friend of yours

choices: There's a news bulletin, Sapphira's escaped!
14421222212111.content:
You answer the door and you see that it wasn't a knock on the roof after all. It was your human friend Sally. Guess you were so used to anthros you expected someone taller. "Down here Alan." "Oh, Sally. Good to see you. What's shaking?" "Why aren't you the one shaking? You put away Sapphira. That's phenomenal."

You let out a nervous laugh as you invite Sally in. "Well, I couldn't let her kill everyone. I told her where the meeting was. She tortured me." Sally then slaps you in the face. "That's nothing compared to what she'll do to you if she catches you again. Sapphira is a true monster. She's a dragon. You better watch yourself." "Sally, Sally, Sally, Sapphira is in jail. She can't touch me." Sally just shook her head and then crossed her hands. "Do you know what happened to the last human who tried to rat out Sapphira?" You give a confused look. "What?" "Sapphira ATE him!" You begin to shake and bite your nails. Sally had a point. Sapphira hated humans and jail or no jail she knows that you were the reason her plan to destroy Coalton Shores failed.

Sally then walked up to you and put her hands on your shoulders. "If I were you, I'd think about leaving town." You considered this, but then you remembered, Sapphira was still in jail and since the authorities knew she was a dragon they most likely took precautions and accounted for her flight and fire breath. Sapphira was locked up and you didn't have anything to worry about. You let out a nervous laugh and put your hand on the table and accidentally turn the TV on.
14421222212111.title: Sally

1442122221212.content:
As you open the door, you look up and see that it was two anthro men in black suits. The taller one was a giant alligator anthro who looked like Godzilla while the shorter one was a gorilla. "Are you Alan....?" asked the alligator. The alligator looks closer at the paper in his hand and even puts on a pair of glasses before letting out a grunt. "Can't read my own hand writing." "Uh yes, I'm Alan." The gorilla picks you up and then speaks to you. "We are Agents Kahn and Zillic. We need to speak to you. Last night you helped put away the most wanted anthro on two planets." "Uh, is that a problem."

Agent Zillic, the alligator lowers his head and gives you a stern look. "You are in grave danger." "Not all of the terrorists were caught last night. Sapphira's second in command, Ruby, managed to escape the onslaught." Agent Zillic holds up a wanted poster of Ruby, a heavyset unicorn anthro, slightly shorter than Sapphira with red fur and a bright red horn that looked like it was painted with blood. You let out a laugh at the poster. "A unicorn?" "Not all unicorns are harmless," said Zillic. "Ruby is the second most wanted anthro criminal there is and not only was she Sapphira's assistant, she was her lover." Kahn then takes over the discussion.

"They know it was you who ratted them out. You were the only human who knew what they were up to. Sapphira wants you dead and Ruby is out there. Do the math." You let out a look of pure fear. One of those horrible monsters escaped and she was coming after you. You shouldn't be surprised seeing as you put a dangerous criminal away. You were in serious trouble.

"Don't panic," said Zillic. "We've come to relocate you. Nobody will know where to find you, especially not Ruby. You'll be moved to another location somewhere on..."
1442122221212.title: Two Men in Black

14421222212121.content:
"I don't know Agent Zillic. That sounds like a bad idea." "Taking you to Zoonova would be too risky," says Agent Kahn. "As you humans say, you'd stick out like a sore thumb." "Fortunately, Coalton Shores isn't the only place on Earth where anthros live. Recently our kind have settled across the world. You're going to need an anthro caretaker in the unlikely event Ruby finds you."

You begin to shake. You wished Zillic wouldn't say that. It was tempting fate. But you didn't think there were any anthros outside of Coalton Shores. But you'd need to be around creatures in Ruby's height class in case that monster got wise to your location. "You'll leave first thing tomorrow." Says Zillic. "We'll take you to the airport. Your new location will be classified. You'll even have a new name. Get ready Alan. Coalton Shores is no longer safe."

The very next day, you packed your bags, dyed your hair and went to say goodbye to everyone. They were all sad to see you go, but Lalonde broke down crying and Betty had to hold her as Zillic and Khan came to pick you up. You shake hands with Meena, Sally and Vixie and high five Reggie before Zillic picks you up and takes you away as his partner follows behind. You look back at everyone and then you turn your head and see Lily looking at you. She waves goodbye and you wave back. You never spoke to Lily but even she seemed concerned for you. You wish you could've said goodbye to Kevin, but he was out of town at the point. It would seem the only ones in the neighborhood who didn't see you off were Baxter and Ryan and you didn't get along with either of them anyway.

Soon, Zillic and Khan have you on a plane leaving Coalton Shores. You have never left the country before, but you had no choice. You put away a dangerous criminal and her most trusted crony was going to be after you. But Zillic and Khan didn't even tell you where you were going. You're heading...
14421222212121.title: Earth, this planet

choices: To see the Carnival in Rio
144212222121211.content:
Your plane lands at your destination and you hear music playing. Then you look out the window and see you are landing near Rio and it's as full of anthro life as ever. As the plane is about to land, two giant macaw anthros fly to the side of the plane and each grab a wing before flying down and placing the plane on the ground. "Hola!" yelled a large river otter anthro. "Welcome to Rio."

You walk out in pure surprise. You didn't think there were giant anthros all around the world, but there were anthros working the airport already in Brazil. As you are looking around, you hear a hissing noise. You look up and see a giant tan skinned hourglass shaped anaconda anthro. She was wearing a large purple cloth around her waist like a skirt along with a black bra and purple sunglasses on the top of her head with long slick backed yellow-green hair. You step back out of fear but the anaconda woman lowers her head and you're in front of her lips far bigger than any human building.

"Hola," she says. "Are you Alan?" "Uh yeah." The anaconda woman hisses at you and feels you around with her tongue. "So this is the hero who got Sapphira put behind bars. My name is Bella. Bella Constrictor. I am your new host. You will be living with me until Ruby is captured. But since you are such a fine specimen of human, I hope that never happens." "Whao!" you yell as Bella lifts you up by the shirt with her giant tail and then places you on her shoulder as she slithers off. You already had a friend in Rio, albeit a giant scaly snake woman friend.

Where does Bella take you?
144212222121211.title: Big in Brazil

1442122221212111.content: How about another warm place to move to ?
1442122221212111.title: Another story option?

14421222212121112.content: How about we start by going south. Like for instance... the state of Texas.
14421222212121112.title: go to another hot place.

144212222121211121.content:
Ah, Texas. The state of big hats, livestock and freedom. Anyways here's a little backstory to set the stage

The first anthro settlers that arrived in Texas accidentally brought some fauna from Zoonova. The average Zoonovan tick was completely harmless to the colossal anthros, but the smaller ones were the size of a car. In an environment where they have no natural predators they thrived, attacking livestock, devouring crops and assaulting people, causing billions in damages. The invasive species was eventually restricted to the area of Texas thanks to human and anthro efforts. To this day swarms of Zoonovan ticks cause problems for farmers. The good thing is that an Anthro who's ready to get his or her feet dirty could make a fortune as an exterminator. Bad thing is that a lot of people still hold a grudge against the anthroes for introducing this invasive species.

A new neighborhood means new neighbors, new neighbors calls for a new introduction page:

---
The Cast
---

The Humans

Alan: The main character, you!

Stanton: An old fashioned farmer in his sixties. Holds a grudge against most anthros and you to an extent, because you live among them

Emily: One of the few humans in town and Stanton's daughter. She is tolerant towards anthros unlike her father.

The Anthros

Della:A giant cowgirl. She's Betty's older cousin and your new caretaker. Small world eh? Appearance wise she resembles her cousin a lot: pudgy, hard working and cheery. She's heard a lot of good things about you and plans to get to know you better. She works for Stanton and helps around the farm, her boss respects her enough as to not call her names.

Trish: A well toned, giant anthro rattle snake. When she was a little kid and her family was out for a walk and she spotted some Zoonovan tick over the sidewalk on a warm summer day, she always went there and stomped the absolute slime out of the tiny insect. Then she looked up at her parents as if she expected a compliment. Now she does much of the same, except she gets paid to do it. She seems nice but you're not sure how to feel about her. She mostly wears short jeans and a short shirt that reveals her well toned abs.

Emma: A skinny Coyote anthro. She is an apathetic grocery store cashier, who consistently sounds as disinterested as she can possibly be. She has a liking for you, stating that you're the only person in town who doesn't bore or annoy her to death on a daily basis. Usually wears really skimpy clothes.

“It stands for Doe, but you should see your new guardian soon. Her appearance is very similar to a friend of yours; she is a government sanctioned worker who has agreed to house, and protect you. Around you were various Anthros, and humans; many of the Anthros were reptiles or non-hooved mammals, being in Texas you expected to see more cows, and horses “Speaking of Anthros, he didn’t even tell me what race my guardian is.” you mumble to yourself.

As if on cue, you start hearing the clacking of hooves, as you crane your head to the source you see something odd “Is that Betty? No wait... is that what he meant by someone similar?” she begins to look around as if searching for someone, eventually her eyes land on you, and a grin spreads on her face. She walks up to you, and begins talking to you as she leans down “Well hello there sug’ you’re lookin' mighty lost. I don’t suppose you’re looking for little ol’ me?” “Umm” is all you manage to respond with. “I’ll take that as a yes.” she giggles as she offers a hand for you to get on. You have second thoughts about climbing on, but she seems to be a relative of Betty, so you go ahead, and climb on. She brings you up to eye level, and begins to introduce herself “My name is Della, and I suppose you must be David D. Johnson?” you nod at her question “Wonderful, welcome to Texas Alan... I mean David.” she winks.

"Get a life Geoff," says Fang. "I have no time to waste with you. I have a human I'm showing the neighborhood to." Fang points to you and Geoff gives a look of surprise.

Then Geoff laughs his head off. "Come on Fang, you deserve better than that flea." "Hey!" you shout. Fang just growls. "For your information sand brain, Alan got Sapphira put behind bars." Geoff looked at Fang and then at you in disbelief before laughing again. "What did he do, bite her big toe. Come on Fang. Ditch the human and get with the big dog. Ruff! Ruff!"

The anthro girl you were looking up at was a titanic two-horned rhinoceros woman, slightly pudgy, but very strong looking and larger than a normal anthro. "Uh yeah," you say nervously. "And you're pretty big for an anthro." "My name is Raquel," she said. "I trust you are Alan." You nod your head. "Listen. I'm only here because I need a place to hide from Ruby." "I heard. Taking out Sapphira. Vunderbar. She's considered a monster even up here. Her cronies killed a close friend of mine because she fell in love vith a human." You shivered. Sapphira was truly evil and you put her away. "Fortunately for you," said Raquel. "I run a library that is also mein home. You can hide there and Ruby vill never find you." Raquel smiles and shows you her huge teeth. She may have been an herbivore but her teeth were the size of houses to you and that scared you.

You were not so sure about trusting Raquel. After all, you had one horned monster after you and you were a little nervous. A rhino wasn't too far from a unicorn. You look up and gasp because something really terrifying was in view. Your new anthro roommate was a purple skinned tyrannosaurus girl with black stripes on her body and bright green eyes. Unlike other female anthros (even the reptilian ones) she was bald. She was muscular and was wearing cargo shorts with a tanktop that showed her large abs and breasts.

You try to walk away by the T-Rex girl lifts you up and then she exhales and shows her monstrous teeth. "You're Alan right?" You just flinch and then look up at the T-Rex girl. "Please don't kill me," you say. "I didn't want to run into Sapphira." The tyrannosaurus then realizes what you're worried about. "I get it, you're lumping dinosaurs in with dragons. We're different species. And I'm not going to hurt you for the Sapphira incident." You stop flinching and look up to see the T-Rex was smiling and had sincere eyes.

"I am Tiana," she says. "And I'm actually glad you got rid of Sapphira." "Y-You are..." Tiana nods her head. "My father worked for Omnipol," she says with a sad look on her face. "He was selected to infiltrate Sapphira's gang. Sapphira's goons consist mainly of mythical or dinosaur anthros so he was the perfect choice for a spy. He spent two years undercover sending Omnipol as much information on Sapphira as he could. But Sapphira got wise to my father's true allegiance after a while and she was furious."

Tiana actually shows tears in her eyes as she wipes her face. "The next day we received his ashes." You give a look of sympathy. "I'm terribly sorry for your loss Tiana." Tiana gives a sigh. "I'm just glad somebody finally put Sapphira behind bars. She'll get life for her crimes and dragons can live for a very, very long time. Come on, I'll show you around Zoonova."

Tiana places you in the center of her snout before walking forward. You were relieved that she wouldn't hurt you. You guess dinosaurs and dragons aren't as close as you think and Tiana was more than happy that you got rid of the criminal who killed her dad. And to think, you put away a monster that could turn the king of the dinosaurs into cinders. It's almost a scary thought.

Where does Tiana take you?

You continue to look in awe at the male black panther who had grabbed you and was currently placing you onto his other hand. And once this happened you realized that the anthro was 5,000 feet in height, not only that but he had huge muscles which made his short sleeve shirt and jeans look skin tight on him. When you looked up at his face though you didn't see any ill intent in his golden eyes as he then began to walk down the sidewalk. And so you cleared your throat and attempted to make conversation with the anthro as you said, "Okay, I don't mean to pry or anything. But where exactly are you taking me? Of course if you don't want to tell me that, then could at least tell me your name?" You then placed your right hand onto your chest when you added, "Here I'll start. My name is Alan."

"Well, I suppose I could explain a few things. Firstly my name is Hank, and it's nice to meet you Alan." The panther told you, before you were brought closer to his face. You then heard him purr a little while he continued with, "Secondly you should know Alan that I'm a gay male stripper who is heading to a party to put on a private show. And I need your help."

Hearing what the muscled giant did for a living made you blush as you let out, "You're a stripper? But....what could I do to help you during your performance?"

He then kept on going with, "Because you see a friend of mine who is also a human was suppose to help me out with this as a favor. But he sadly got really sick and couldn't come today." "Oh well, um what exactly would I have to do?" You asked, as you tried to regain your emotions.

"Ah, but that's the best part because you won't have to do anything. All you have to do is let me rub you up against my muscled body from top to bottom." Hank stated, which made your eyes widen once more. However, the panther saw this and quickled you reassured you, "But don't worry you're in good hands since I've done whit routine with other humans tons of times." You were then brought right up to his lips before he added in a whisper, "And once my job is done then I promise to thank you for helping me."

"I....okay, I'll help." You let out, before you were suddenly pressed up against the giant black lisp of the panther.

This caused your eyes to widen in shock as you weren't expecting the heavily muscled cat to do something like this. However, the kiss didn't last long and after he had pulled you away from his lips he told you, "Thanks, Alan. I promise you won't regret it."

"S-Sure. N-No problem." You stuttered, as you tried to recover from being kissed by a giant male anthro.

However, once Hank had reached the place where his private gig was taking place you couldn't help, but wonder how this would turn out in the end.

145.content:
Your mind briefly flashed back to the news, more specifically, the anti-anthro rally going on in the human side of town. You grimaced slightly in disgust at the thought. The mayor was always trying to get the anthros out of the town, by any means necessary. You have no idea why some people still vote for him to lead the town. You've even had a conversation with the man before. One of the most bigoted, angry, and dim-witted man you've ever met. Overall, it was a very unpleasant chat. It was right before you had moved into the anthro side of Coalton Shores, and he was trying to win votes. You argued that the anthros were no harm, and they were very peaceful for a majority of them. He simply glared at you, called you a dope-smoking, hippie-creating, giant-loving idiot and took off.

That was almost four years ago, and now he was at it again to get the giant beings out of the small community. With a sigh, you got in your car drove off to the other side of town to see just what was going on with this rally.

When you arrived, you were greeted with various hate signs that said 'NO ALIENS WELCOME' or 'GIANTS GO HOME', or your favorite 'ANTHROS WILL BRING ABOUT THE END TIMES'. You stepped out of your car to a crowd, mostly older folks, surrounding a stage, Mayor Bloomberg in the center of it, screaming angrily. When wasn't this guy red in the face?

"The Anthros are stealing all of our supplies! Soon, nothing will be left for us humans!"You heard him say as you reclined in the very back of the crowd. You rolled your eyes. The anthros were too big to even use any of earth's resources, that's why they bring their own from their home planet. Hell, they've even helped restore some of environment!"

"Eventually, all the air in our atmosphere will be gone because they've sucked it all up!"

Once again, the anthros technology helped with that. While on our planet, they barely need to breathe at all.

"What about all the help they've given us!"You shout out above the crowd. Bloomberg furiously looked around for whoever called out such blasphemy."There hasn't been any military conflict on earth for over a hundred years! Our oceans are clean, our air is fresher! Plus, they're really nice!"

"Who's saying that?!"He screamed. The crowd parted to reveal you in the back. You had hoped to remain hidden, but at least the spotlight was shared. Bloomberg's eyes narrowed at you."Alan...the giant lover who lives on their side of town."

"'Sup?"You casually wave at him with a big ol' shit-eating grin.
145.title: The Anti-Anthro Rally

1452.content:
Everything suddenly became quite as a vast shadow, miles long, stretched across the protest. In fact, multiple shadows, bathing the entire human area of Coalton Shores in the darkness of the giant anthros towering over it. You, along with the rest of the tiny humans down below, looked up to see a group of maybe around five to six anthros looking down at you all, their collection of toes and paws and claws towering over the puny buildings as gigantic walls that went beyond the clouds.

One anthro knelt down as slow as she possibly could, knowing that any sudden movement from her could destroy this portion of the town. She was an eagle anthro, and she seemed nice enough despite her piercing eyes and shark beak. She kept lowering herself until her massive, miles-spanning face was directly above, her expression gentle yet firm."Humans,"She greeted the majority of the group."Mayor Bloomberg,"She turned to him next, his cowering form shivering as her eyes fell upon him.

"I know there are many reasons you have gathered here today. But I assure, we are no threat to you humans. I am Hilda, one of the locals that live in the neighborhood across town. Notice the word 'local'-I've lived here and grown up in Coalton Shores along with the rest of you. Heck, I even went to school with some of your kids."She giggled slightly, still not alleviating the fears of the bigoted below. You did recall that her face was familiar, as were the other anthros around. There was a multi-special school just out of the way of town, and you had attended it growing up in your earlier years before your parents moved you into a human school once you got into high school. Hilda was one of your classmates way back when.

"Is there anything I can do to make you feel better about us?"Hilda pleaded.

"Get off our fuckin' planet!"One brave anon from within the crowd yelled up at her, only for the rest to follow with raised fists and a "Yeah!"

Hilda only rolled her eyes, followed by a small sigh that threatened to blow everyone away."We come in peace, humans, to protest your...protest against us."
1452.title: Peaceful Protest

1453.content:
Before Mayor Bloomberg could say anything to you, there was a sudden quake. "What's going on." "Anthros." Muttered the mayor with venom in his words. Of course, it didn't sound like one anthro, it sounded like three and that was the least of your problems. Suddenly flames erupted from the walls. "Fire!" one of the guards yelled. Everyone begins to panic and in the process of the frantic running, Mayor Bloomberg is knocked down, more angered than before and you can tell he's blaming this on the anthros. You could only stand in fear because you realized that it might just have been anthros that set this fire.

You suddenly remember something. A town not too far from Coalton Shores was destroyed by fire. It was believed the fire was caused by terrorists, namely a particularly nasty one by the name of Sapphira. Sapphira was the most dangerous anthro on Earth and Zoonova. She was a huge blue dragon anthro who despised humans utterly and didn't appreciate anti-anthro humans like Mayor Bloomberg. But as bigoted as the mayor was, Sapphira was even worse when it came to humans. Unlike most anthros she'd snuff out any humans she say on the spot. You even heard a rumor that she ate humans.

Everyone is panicking through the fire and tried to run out the door. However, they stop in their tracks as the ceiling is torn off and they see the silhouettes of two giant anthros. The first is a large figured unicorn anthro while the second appears to be a griffin anthro. They were both female in appearance. Everybody steps back as the griffin laughs evil. "Run humans," she mutters in a feral tone. "Humans hate. Kill humans."

These two characters were minions of Sapphira. The griffin was called Topaz and she was the main muscle of Sapphira's gang. She knew how to torture and pulverize humans in ways too grizzly to describe and enjoyed her heinous work a lot more than she should've. The unicorn was called Ruby and she was Sapphira's second in command. She didn't get that position by being Sapphira's girlfriend alone and she was a lot more dangerous than you'd expect of a unicorn. Her horn was bright red, possibly painted with human blood. Both of those titans look down with evil intentions.

Topaz laughs wickedly as Ruby stomps forward. One of the guards takes out a gun and foolishly tries to shoot at Ruby, but at Ruby's size, the shot was barely as bad as a mosquito bite. Ruby turns to the guard who shot her and the guard twitches before trying to run. Ruby simply reaches down and grabs hold of him as he screams. "Oh yeah," says Ruby. "Shooting at a 10,000 mile high unicorn. That's real smart." You watch in pure fear as Ruby tosses the guard screaming into her mouth and you hear the sounds of crunching. These anthros weren't like the neighborhood anthros who were all so friendly. These two were real monsters. The scariest part was that you hadn't even seen Sapphira yet.

Of course, even in the face of certain doom, Mayor Bloomberg just has to be an asshole to anthros and as he gets up, he shakes his fist at Ruby and Topaz. "You miscreants! You anthros have proven my point! You're big destructive monsters that have no business being on Earth! Go back where you came from!" Topaz lets out a grunt and lowers her hand. She flicks her fingers and sends the mayor across the room. "Loud bug," she mutters. "Flick! Flick!" "Anyone else want to say anything?" asks Ruby as she lowers her head down. Ruby even licks another guard to make him freak out.

Her name was Shiari, or at least that's the closest approximation that our human tongues can pronounce. She was one of many of the planetary beings who came to Earth long ago and, upon seeing the condition it was in (environmental catastrophes, nuclear war, etc.)... offered humanity a way to possibly escape the fate they were seemingly on.

They offered their bodies as our new homes. Each one was roughly the size of Earth, so it was possible. You don't know how your family came to live on Shiari, but she has been a great guide to the descendants of her first settlement. Though she discouraged it, many of the descendants of her first passengers grew to view her as their goddess. And who could blame them? She was aware of our presence (being a seemingly omipotent telepath will do that), protected us, and allowed us to live and thrive amongst her heavenly body.

But despite that, she's a very patient person, gentle to the insignificant passengers who probably cover her entire body as she drifts through space.

Didn't hurt that she was pretty too.

Well, enough stalling...

You awoke in your bed to the 'alarm clock' that was Shiari's voice in your head. "Wake up Alan, time to start the day anew." You heard stories of how the original settlers were a bit unnerved by this at first, the idea that not only were you living on something sentient, but it also knew your name and kept track of you on it's body. But to the subsequent generations it just became apart of life on Planet Shiari.

"How's the day looking so far Madam?" you asked through thought. A light gentle ripple quivered through the city, she found your question to be amusing. "Not too bad, passing through the Ax*Lrxt!alax# Nebula, a region of the cosmos with large amounts of ice planets. So a nice temperature should be on the schedule today." she replied, sounding like she was right THERE in the room. Chuckling you headed over the food replicator, to have some breakfast. As you walked over, Shiari sent you images and numbers and statistics about your health, as well as suggestions for what to eat to stay healthy. Of course this is purely up to you, though the 'planet' was worried about your health.

Another thing that weirded out the initial settlers.

155.content:
The universe, as you should know, is a pretty big place - to wildly understate its size. Most people's minds can comprehend, at best, the size of the solar system. Perhaps the distance between Sol and Alpha Centauri if they're good with picturing things in their head.

Galaxy-sized anthros would be pretty hard to comprehend. It'd take over one hundred thousand years to travel from their toes to their head, if you were traveling at the speed of light. Even at that size, they'd be able to truthfully call themselves gods.

But not just universe-sized, but being so utterly, incomprehensibly gargantuan that you dwarf it? How could a normal human ever hope to compare with beings so powerful they could end existence just by blinking? How could a member of such an astonishingly gigantic race even sense a living thing that is so tiny that electrons and neutrons would be too large to compare them to? Would such a mind-breakingly big race feel anything towards such utterly vulnerable beings?

Whether for better or for worse, it seems that these anthros, so huge that the Elder Gods would lose their alien minds at the sight of them, are capable of sensing humans, and of feeling emotion towards them.

This is where you come in - what role will you, the tiny human, play? You are...

1551.content:
Knelt inside the small shrine you had dedicated to your goddess, you can't help but feel at peace. Here, it was just you and Her. No one else to disturb your worship or deny Her existence. No one to try convince you to worship their pantheon and lead you away from Her.

Your shrine was a small one, but you like to think it makes up for that by using its space well. The entire thing was inside a small cave opening, which you had hidden with a mass of different types of foliage to prevent those who would stop your worship from finding your shrine. A small pool sunken into the floor takes up a fair amount of space - in fact, you are kneeling in the pool at this very moment. A small piece of log, about as long as your forearm and slightly thicker than your leg, is placed at the end of the pool opposite the entrance. Upon the log are mounted several of your most prized possessions - all depictions of Her. Of Her beyond-beautiful cetacean features.

A small statuette crudely carved out of wood; a lovingly detailed drawing that you had spent many hours on; a small dolphin plush toy, painstakingly dyed and re-dyed many times over so as to perfectly emulate her colours.

In a state of religious awe, you clutch the plush dolphin with shaking hands, engulfing it in a crushing hug. You had known about Her for almost as long as you could remember - since early childhood, no doubt. Recurring visions of Her, of your goddess, had been brushed off by your peers as either superstitious nonsense or possible heresy, depending on who you talked to. But you knew that She was real. You had seen Her in perfect detail many times over, Her wondrous form suspended in a sea of tiny globes of blazing light.

But She had never noticed you. No matter how hard you prayed, no matter what you tried to earn Her attention for even the briefest of moments, She remained blind to your worship.

Seizing the carving in one hand while keeping the plushy held in the other, you rest your forehead against it as you attempt to regain control of your breathing, which is coming in short, ragged bursts. And yet, something feels different, somehow. As if something was gently touching the edges of your mind.

"Hello, little one."

You stare ahead, mouth wide open. She- She had noticed you...

"I must apologize for not noticing you until now, little one. It is so hard to hear prayers at my size. even those as fervent as yours. Please, little one, exit your shrine. I will pick you up once you are outside."

A smile of pure, dumb bliss on your face, you stumble out of the shrine, heart pumping wildly. Everything seems to go quiet for a second - before a noise like the universe itself roaring fills your ears, and a translucent blue hand plunges downwards from the clouds in the distance, as your vision begins to blacken.

"Here we go, little one! Make sure to hold on tight - if you can!"

--


Groaning, you clutch your pounding head as you awaken. Your entire being feels scrambled, your thoughts fuzzy and not-quite-there. The sharp, stabbing pains of a migraine assault your head relentlessly. The migraine and strange sensations seem to fade all of a sudden, however, and you realize that you are laying on the ground.

The ground in question is warm. Delightfully so, in fact. And it feels... Rubbery?

Opening your eyes at last, you roll onto your back and sit up. The stormy-grey ground seems to stretch endlessly before you, an infinite plane of rubbery grey skin making up the ground. Above you is what initially seems to be the night sky - but on closer inspection, the pinpricks of stars turn out to be infinitesimally small globes of light.

An elated smile appears on your face. You're here, with Her; your goddess; your deity. Looking behind you, you gawp as you behold a gigantic iris, many trillions of miles in diameter - if not even larger. You can only see it in its entirety due to its sheer, mind-boggling distance from you. You've been held on one of Her fingertips this entire time.

Your dolphin goddess lets loose a giggle that could destroy the Milky Way through sheer force.
"Well then, my little worshipper, it's a pleasure to meet you face to face. You can call me the Goddess Cora."
1551.title: Noticed By Your Goddess

15512.content:
You can't help but fall to your knees, softly landing on a fraction of a fraction of the feather that was playing host to you. Your goddess had chosen you, of all her followers, to be allowed the privilege of seeing Her with your own eyes; of touching Her with your own hands. And She had hinted that goddesses of other pantheons were interested in you, as well. It was almost too much for you to take in.

What definitely was too much for you to take in, however, was Her sheer, incalculable size. She was so vast that the tips of Her feathers alone could have swept through the Milky Way and scattered it into dust. So vast that Her omnipresent, gentle crooning alone, was almost causing your mind to buckle from sensory overload. So vast that the universe itself could - and had - easily fit into any of Her orifices.

Nix, the Mother of the Night, Matriarch of Ravenkind, Mistress of the Lunar Cycle, and Queen of Darkness, stretches into infinity beyond, behind, above, and below you. Her form exuded a comforting warmth, and Her power kept you insulated from the harmful Void in between universes. Limited human mind too weak to comprehend Her majesty and power, whatever Her true form may have been was being interpreted as an indescribably gargantuan anthropomorphic raven.

When She speaks, Her voice rumbles and trembles with raw, undiluted power, and Her claws are so long and so wide that She could hold the entire universe between two of them - possibly without even feeling it. You prostrate yourself, shouting words of praise for the All-Mother until your voice is little more than a hoarse croak. A gentle and appreciative, yet still impossibly loud croon comes from way, way above, and a clawtip capable of giving the multiverse competition in terms of size strokes your form as much as it can with the disparity in size. Despite the massiveness of the claw, you feel no pain, nor pressure - just a gentle stroking.

"Mmm, I think I'm going to enjoy this arrangement, little one," Nix says, the sheer volume of her utterance causing your ears to ring. "And, in fact, I have the perfect task for you to undertake to please your goddess..."

155211.content:
"G-gone?!" you squeak. "What do you mean, gone?"

Lexi's mental projection draws you in to her beautiful body, arms wrapped around you squeezing you even tighter. "I'm sorry, Alan. Gone. I wasn't able to see how or why the Earth is gone, but I was able to save you, at least. And the others were able to save a few dozens humans each - I was one of the last to notice that Earth was gone."

"I- I..." you stutter. "How many humans are left?" Lexi's projection hugs you all the tighter. Her embrace should have, by all rights, reduced to you a fine paste with her strength, but somehow no matter how tight the hug gets, you never feel even the slightest bit of discomfort. Just a loving warmth. "A few... Hundred..." Lexi says, sadly.

Your mind seems to go blank. A few hundred humans were all that was left. Head drooping downwards, you screw your eyes shut and push yourself into the construct's soft fur, tears beginning to flow once again. "Oh, Alan..." Lexi croons, both from her construct and from her actual body, utterance shaking you slightly. Lexi's construct softly kisses the top of your head as she holds your tiny body against her.

Wrapping your arms as far around her as you can, you hug the construct, comparatively feeble, stick-like arms encircling her torso as far as you can manage. It takes a while, but eventually the tears stop, and Lexi releases her grip on you, placing another soft kiss on the top of your head.

"So, uh," you begin, wishing to take your mind off of Earth and humanity's current circumstances. "Just how big are you, Lexi? And how did you get so big?"

"Well, little bro, you see..."
155211.title: Survivor

info.brief_description: A race of gargantuan creatures come to earth, but are they peaceful or hostile?
info.description:
You cannot remember much, but as far back as your memory goes, the giant anthros have always been around. They arrived on earth long before your own time from a planet entirely inhabited by the titanic beings, their homeworld known as Zoonova, and they've used their highly-advanced technology to exist somewhat peacefully beside the human race. People like you have come to accept them, seeing that you live in a neighborhood where a majority of the residents are these furries and some are your friends, but others revile them for simply existing, even though these gigantic creatures could conquer earth in less than an hour's time. Fortunately, most of them are quite peaceful.

You are Alan, a pretty simple guy, living a simple life in the small town of Coalton Shores, a mining community. Let's see what happens with these massive beings around you, shall we?

-----
The Cast
-----

The Humans

Alan: The main character, you!

Kevin: One of your few friends that share a species with you. You don't see him much now that you've moved to the anthro neighborhood.

Sally: Another friend, but you do see her occasionally. The only other human who lives with the giants.

Mayor Bloomberg: Incredibly crotchety and ill-tempered, the mayor does everything in his power to discriminate and subject the extraterrestrial visitors.

Your Neighborhood

Meena: Your next door neighbor, a petite(not relative to you), cute batgirl. Has dark grey fur, usually wears wide rimmed glasses for her bad eyes. She's incredibly shy, even towards you. Usually wears lots of fan t-shirts for videogames for television shows, seeing as how she has geeky interests in those.

Vixie: Lives in the house across from you. A curvaceous fox woman. You don't really talk to her much, but she's friendly enough.

Reggie: Short for Regina. An incredibly hyper hyena woman that lives a few houses down. Always has rainbow streaks running through her mohawked hair, a couple piercings dotting her face, and a wild grin wherever she roams. She actually thinks you're a pretty cool guy, and she's invited you a couple times to watch her band play. You've never actually gone, however...

Lalonde: You think she's french, if giant anthros from outer space could be french. A sheep girl with tinted pink wool(possibly dyed), and incredibly curvaceous and busty at that. If she were to be measured in human standards, you believe she'd be an H-cup. You think she's nice, and she finds all humans absolutely adorable to their small size. This leads to her treating you as a toy instead of a person sometimes. Usually wears really skimpy stuff.

Baxter: Arctic Wolf. You're not on good terms with him. The guy holds a grudge against humans for some reason.

Around Town

Betty: A pudgy, if not cute cowgirl with a large chest that nearly matches Lalonde's. Runs the local supermarket. Cheery, hard-working, and southern to the bone. Usually seen in work jeans and something plaid.

Ryan: Husky. Works at the video store that you visit frequently. He doesn't particularly like you considering that you return all of the movies late.

Lily: An odd, gothic catgirl with soot-colored fur. You see her wandering around town all the time, but you never speak to her, and she never speaks to anyone. Always has her massive black leather boots on, some tight jeans, and a black hoodie that blends into her fur.

From Out of Town

Sapphira: A massive dragoness, bright blue in scale color, possibly a European dragon, also known as both planet's most wanted anthro terrorist. Known to crush entire human cities in an afternoon, it's a mysterious how she's avoided being caught for years. Leads a group of Anti-Human Anthros.

-----
The Rules
-----
1. Have fun.
2. The basic rules for my other stories. You read them? You should know. If not, check 'em out, or even message me.
3. Giants are allowed, I suppose...
4. These creatures are to be HUGE. A mile tall is the bare bones minimum for their height.
5. This story is to be told in 2nd person perspective, as in 'you'.
6. No ending the story, 'kay?
7. Feel free to add characters!
info.pretty_title: When the Anthros Came to Town
